				Peter Perrett + Jamie Perrett

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									07/10/2025								
														Time:2025/10/07 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull HU5 2DD
															
																										 Postponed
											
					
				

				A message from the promoter Under the Influence
SHOW POSTPONED // We’re sorry to announce that due to artist illness, tonight’s Peter Perrett at Hull’s The New Adelphi Club will not go ahead as planned. We’re working on a new date and will update all ticket holder asap. Apologies for the inconvenience.
All existing tickets remain valid for the new date, and ticket holders have been updated via an email from their point of purchase.
Under the Influence presents
Peter Perrett
+ Jamie Perrett
Tuesday 7th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Doors 8pm
14+ Under 18s must be accompanied by an Adult
Singer-songwriter and former The Only Ones frontman, Peter Perrett, joins us in Hull.
As the leader of The Only Ones in the late ’70s, he was one of the new wave’s most enigmatic cult figures, his songs combined a razor-sharp sense of melody and a dark, sardonic wit, making him one of the more unique voices of the era.
His solo albums reflect on the years that have passed since, with his uniquely narcotic and alluring melodies, gorgeous South London drawl, and ravishing rock dynamic now allied to a wider span of musical arrangements and lyrical concerns

HU5 2RU

title: Jesus Jones + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Jesus Jones + Support Date: 08/10/2025 Time:2025/10/08 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents… Jesus Jones + Support Wednesday 8 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £25 Adv from seetickets *All tickets remain valid Jesus Jones formed back in 1988 born out of the struggles of everyday bands and their battles to find their own voice. The band’s vocalist guitarist and principal songwriter Mike Edwards was frustrated with a lack of progress and stung by a music business that seemed to have passed them by. That was until he came across an as-yet unproven new technology: sampling. A cheap guitar pedal could be tweaked to grab sounds and replay them twisting them into new forms. That lightbulb moment led to their debut single “Info Freako ” a rapid-fire burst of anarchic sonic attack with breakbeats and funky b-lines josting for attention over walls of brutal guitar and yelped vocals. It quickly set a blueprint and armed with a proper-brand-new sampler their debut album “Liquidizer” soon followed. The press in the UK finally sat up and took notice. Edwards was on a roll. That run of success quickly snowballed as the band released their second album “Doubt” in 1991. The band’s pop sensibilities and innovative approach found new eager audiences worldwide. The album became a phenomenon in the United States selling over a million copies. Their single “Right Here Right Now” became an iconic moment in the language of early 90’s crossover hits racing to the top of the US charts. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				Screaming Tarts presents…
Jesus Jones
+ Support
Wednesday 8th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£25 Adv from seetickets
*All tickets remain valid
Jesus Jones formed back in 1988, born out of the struggles of everyday bands and their battles to find their own voice. The band’s vocalist, guitarist and principal songwriter, Mike Edwards was frustrated with a lack of progress, and stung by a music business that seemed to have passed them by. That was until he came across an as-yet unproven new technology: sampling. A cheap guitar pedal could be tweaked to grab sounds and replay them, twisting them into new forms. That lightbulb moment led to their debut single “Info Freako,” a rapid-fire burst of anarchic sonic attack, with breakbeats and funky b-lines josting for attention over walls of brutal guitar and yelped vocals. It quickly set a blueprint and, armed with a proper-brand-new sampler, their debut album “Liquidizer” soon followed.
The press in the UK finally sat up and took notice. Edwards was on a roll. That run of success quickly snowballed as the band released their second album “Doubt” in 1991. The band’s pop sensibilities and innovative approach found new, eager audiences worldwide. The album became a phenomenon in the United States, selling over a million copies. Their single “Right Here, Right Now” became an iconic moment in the language of early 90’s crossover hits, racing to the top of the US charts.

									08/10/2025

				Screaming Tarts presents…
Jesus Jones
+ Support
Wednesday 8th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£25 Adv from seetickets
*All tickets remain valid
Jesus Jones formed back in 1988, born out of the struggles of everyday bands and their battles to find their own voice. The band’s vocalist, guitarist and principal songwriter, Mike Edwards was frustrated with a lack of progress, and stung by a music business that seemed to have passed them by. That was until he came across an as-yet unproven new technology: sampling. A cheap guitar pedal could be tweaked to grab sounds and replay them, twisting them into new forms. That lightbulb moment led to their debut single “Info Freako,” a rapid-fire burst of anarchic sonic attack, with breakbeats and funky b-lines josting for attention over walls of brutal guitar and yelped vocals. It quickly set a blueprint and, armed with a proper-brand-new sampler, their debut album “Liquidizer” soon followed.
The press in the UK finally sat up and took notice. Edwards was on a roll. That run of success quickly snowballed as the band released their second album “Doubt” in 1991. The band’s pop sensibilities and innovative approach found new, eager audiences worldwide. The album became a phenomenon in the United States, selling over a million copies. Their single “Right Here, Right Now” became an iconic moment in the language of early 90’s crossover hits, racing to the top of the US charts.

dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Miki Berenyi Trio + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 21/10/2024 Time:2024/10/21 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £12 Advance The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations Former LUSH lead singer/guitarist brings her new band to Hull! Miki Berenyi Trio + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph Monday 21 October 2024 Tickets £12 Advance (on this page) or £14.00 OTD Doors 8.00pm Miki Berenyi Trio are Miki Berenyi on vocals/guitar (Lush) Kevin ‘Moose’ McKillop on guitar (Moose) and Oliver Cherer (Gilroy Mere Aircooled). The three musicians first worked together during Piroshka’s 2021 tour – Miki and Kevin being founder members Oliver coming in on bass to replace Mick Conroy (Modern English) who had moved to the US. When the global pandemic made touring impossible Miki spent the lockdown months writing her memoir Fingers Crossed released in 2022 to widespread acclaim. To provide some musical accompaniment for the string of book events and signings Miki Berenyi Trio was formed. The band has developed a momentum of its own touring with the Wedding Present and Gang of Four and sold out London co-headline show with Aircooled. Miki Berenyi Trio are planning to record and release an album in 2024. Their debut single ‘Vertigo’ was released via Bella Union on May 8 2024 + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Man The Lifeboats + Support Date: 11/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £15 Adv Click Here Screaming Tarts presents… Man The Lifeboats + Support Saturday October 11 2025 The New Adelphi Club £15 Adv Click Here Doors:8.00pm Man The Lifeboats began life in a shanty-punk folk mosh pit in 2016. Skinny Lister and Holy Moly & the Crackers were the two bands that lit the fire and blew the roof of the Garage that night. Fast forward 9 years and 100+ gigs and Man The Lifeboats are ploughing their full-throttle folked-up furrow on the festival circuit winning over audiences at Moseley Purbeck Warwick Swanage Jurassic Fields Beardy Folk Folk in a Field Bearded Theory Deepdale Ragged Bear and more drawing comparisons to Bellowhead Waterboys Oysterband the Levellers and those folk-punk heroes the Pogues. The second album Soul Of Albion hit no. 27 in the Official Folk Charts in 2022. Recorded at Rockfield Studios it sounds like Led Zeppelin arm-wrestling Shane McGowan in a Birmingham brewery like Jimbo band Fruitbat fronting Fairport Convention like The Albion Band turned up to 11 with their fiddles on fire. Tonic for these troubled times. Tickets on sale here >>> https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3361319 Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Screaming Tarts presents…
Man The Lifeboats
+ Support

Saturday October 11th 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£15 Adv Click Here
Doors:8.00pm
Man The Lifeboats began life in a shanty-punk folk mosh pit in 2016.


Skinny Lister and Holy Moly & the Crackers were the two bands that lit the fire and blew the roof of the Garage that night.
Fast forward 9 years and 100+ gigs and Man The Lifeboats are ploughing their full-throttle folked-up furrow on the festival circuit, winning over audiences at Moseley, Purbeck, Warwick, Swanage, Jurassic Fields, Beardy Folk, Folk in a Field, Bearded Theory, Deepdale, Ragged Bear and more, drawing comparisons to Bellowhead, Waterboys, Oysterband, the Levellers, and those folk-punk heroes the Pogues.
The second album Soul Of Albion hit no. 27 in the Official Folk Charts in 2022. Recorded at Rockfield Studios, it sounds like Led Zeppelin arm-wrestling Shane McGowan in a Birmingham brewery, like Jimbo band Fruitbat fronting Fairport Convention, like The Albion Band turned up to 11 with their fiddles on fire. Tonic for these troubled times.
Tickets on sale here >>>


https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3361319

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Ryder The Eagle + Roy Molloy + Matt Edible Date: 12/10/2025 Time:2025/10/12 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street hull HU5 2RU £10 ADV CLICK HERE Under the Influence presents… RYDER THE EAGLE plus guest Roy Molloy + Matt Edible Sunday 12 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Hull 14+ | 20.00HRS | £10 ADV DIY hero fallen Romeo karaoke weirdo — the Mexico-based French balladeer is everything (and nothing) you might expect from an art-rock divorcé chasing dreams at your local dive bar. With lo-fi synthy soundscapes lyrical melodies poetic songwriting and cathartic one-of-a-kind performances Ryder The Eagle tells his history with love more than his love stories – coating romantic despair with a chiseled wit that’ll transport you straight into a Kaurismäki movie soundtracked by a caffeine-driven Leonard Cohen. ROY MOLLOY Roy Molloy is best known as the enigmatic long-standing business partner of Australian singer-songwriter Alex Cameron. With his debut solo project Molloy steps into a new artistic space. His music combines krautrock instrumentals dry wit and hard-wrought horn solos. Equal parts storytelling and mood-building Molloy’s set represents a shift toward a more personal expressive sound marking a new chapter in his career as a performer and writer. MATT EDIBLE Matt Edible has been a jewel in the crown of Hull’s music scene for many years. From fronting cult avant-pop heroes Edible 5ft Smiths to The Holy Orders to his latest project Matt Edible & The Obtuse Angels. Matt’s solo shows are intimate affairs that range from goosebump-inducing pin drop moments to raging vocal acrobatics. 				Ryder The Eagle + Roy Molloy + Matt Edible

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									12/10/2025								
														Time:2025/10/12 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 £10 ADV CLICK HERE
											
					
				

				

Under the Influence presents…
RYDER THE EAGLE
plus guest Roy Molloy
+ Matt Edible
Sunday 12th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club Hull
14+ | 20.00HRS | £10 ADV
DIY hero, fallen Romeo, karaoke weirdo — the Mexico-based French balladeer is everything (and nothing) you might expect from an art-rock divorcé chasing dreams at your local dive bar. With lo-fi synthy soundscapes, lyrical melodies, poetic songwriting, and cathartic one-of-a-kind performances, Ryder The Eagle tells his history with love more than his love stories – coating romantic despair with a chiseled wit that’ll transport you straight into a Kaurismäki movie soundtracked by a caffeine-driven Leonard Cohen.
ROY MOLLOY
Roy Molloy is best known as the enigmatic, long-standing business partner of Australian singer-songwriter Alex Cameron. With his debut solo project, Molloy steps into a new artistic space. His music combines krautrock instrumentals, dry wit and hard-wrought horn solos. Equal parts storytelling and mood-building, Molloy’s set represents a shift toward a more personal, expressive sound, marking a new chapter in his career as a performer and writer.
MATT EDIBLE
Matt Edible has been a jewel in the crown of Hull’s music scene for many years. From fronting cult avant-pop heroes Edible 5ft Smiths to The Holy Orders, to his latest project, Matt Edible & The Obtuse Angels. Matt’s solo shows are intimate affairs that range from goosebump-inducing pin drop moments to raging vocal acrobatics.

				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

title: Marcel + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Marcel + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer Date: 13/10/2025 Time:2025/10/13 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street hull HU5 2RU £7.20 Adv Click Here Twisted Nipple Events presents Part of the 41 Anniversary Celebrations Marcel (Belgium) + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer Monday 13 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £7.20 Adv from gigantic We have loud chaotic noise rock band from Belgium Marcel . Always oscillating between the sublime and the ridiculous they excel in a bastardised experimental form of unorthodox punk which will appeal to your anarchist granny as well as your 5 year old nephew who thinks he’s right wing. While 76% of adults who have seen them live claim to have felt a tingly stinging joy according to the eurobarometer. Their latest album was produced by Ben Hampson (Ditz Lambrini Girls). Plus support from our faves Bureau de Change . The loud and rambunctious crime syndicate no one asked for. Specialising in in sardonic tongue in cheek post punk that topples the white male patriarchy. Opening we have our own riotous force of relentless primal noise from Bugfacer. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				Marcel + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									13/10/2025								
														Time:2025/10/13 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 £7.20 Adv Click Here
											
					
				

				Twisted Nipple Events presents
Part of the 41st Anniversary Celebrations
Marcel (Belgium)
+ Bureau de Change
+ Bugfacer
Monday 13th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets £7.20 Adv from gigantic 
We have loud, chaotic noise rock band from Belgium Marcel . Always oscillating between the sublime and the ridiculous, they excel in a bastardised, experimental form of unorthodox punk, which will appeal to your anarchist granny as well as your 5 year old nephew who thinks he’s right wing. While 76% of adults who have seen them live claim to have felt a tingly, stinging joy, according to the eurobarometer.
Their latest album was produced by Ben Hampson (Ditz, Lambrini Girls).
Plus support from our faves Bureau de Change . The loud and rambunctious crime syndicate no one asked for. Specialising in in sardonic, tongue in cheek post punk that topples the white male patriarchy.
Opening we have our own riotous force of relentless primal noise from Bugfacer.

Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU

This is a special night that marks a brand new chapter for Bonneville and you won’t want to miss it. Bonneville returns to the stage with a brand new set and an all-female line-up of exceptionally talented musicians: Flo Avery – guitar & backing vocalsNiamh Readman – drumsEden Jacobs – keysTiana Coley – bass + Muru Support comes from Muru a soulful multi-instrumentalist whose music blends classical roots with funk jazz and electronic textures – creating immersive genre-defying soundscapes. Tuesday 14th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£10 +bf from tickettailor
Doors: 8.00pm
Expect sharp, singable indie-pop poetry filled with northern wit, heartbreak, and humour.
This is a special night that marks a brand new chapter for Bonneville, and you won’t want to miss it.
Bonneville returns to the stage with a brand new set and an all-female line-up of exceptionally talented musicians:
Flo Avery – guitar & backing vocalsNiamh Readman – drumsEden Jacobs – keysTiana Coley – bass
+ Muru
Support comes from Muru, a soulful multi-instrumentalist whose music blends classical roots with funk, jazz, and electronic textures – creating immersive, genre-defying soundscapes.

Grab your tickets now.

				Bonneville + Muru

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									14/10/2025								
														Time:2025/10/14 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Buy Now
											
					
				

				Bonneville
+ Muru
Tuesday 14th October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£10 +bf from tickettailor
Doors: 8.00pm
Expect sharp, singable indie-pop poetry filled with northern wit, heartbreak, and humour.
This is a special night that marks a brand new chapter for Bonneville, and you won’t want to miss it.
Bonneville returns to the stage with a brand new set and an all-female line-up of exceptionally talented musicians:
Flo Avery – guitar & backing vocalsNiamh Readman – drumsEden Jacobs – keysTiana Coley – bass
+ Muru
Support comes from Muru, a soulful multi-instrumentalist whose music blends classical roots with funk, jazz, and electronic textures – creating immersive, genre-defying soundscapes.

Grab your tickets now.
Buy tickets – ✨ Bonneville Live at The Adelphi, Hull ✨ – The Adelphi

title: Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + BuckToothSmelly + More – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + BuckToothSmelly + More Date: 15/10/2025 Time:2025/10/15 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU £5 / PAY WHAT YOU CAN Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + BuckToothSmelly Wednesday 15 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £5 (or) Pay what you can Doors: 8.00pm Though Hans Pucket has been performing frenetic and immediate indie rock in Wellington New Zealand for years their collaboration dates back even further when twin brothers Oliver and Callum Devlin decided to start making music together. In 2014 with Oliver on vocals and guitar and Callum on drums the duo self-released a self-titled EP on Bandcamp. The loose and rambunctious collection of songs caught the ear of drummer Jonathan Nott who quickly joined the band and Oliver says “knew the songs better than we did.” As a three-piece with Callum Devlin now playing bass Hans Pucket released a string of increasingly hook-laden and sophisticated EPs and singles. In 2016 they released the Jalapeño EP and in 2017 put out their breakout single “Fuck My Life ” which boasted a sax-led outro that hinted at a side of the band the Devlins affectionately refer to as “Horns Pucket.” These releases culminated in the band’s first full-length Eczema in 2018 an LP that garnered cosigns from their compatriots The Beths and RNZ. For their sophomore effort No Drama the band decamped to Jonathan Pearce of The Beths’ Auckland studio. Though the result is a much fuller more ambitious sound Hans Pucket decided to stick to their strengths: being a fun live act. “Rather than being a Steely Dan studio band our intention was to make songs that are fun to play live ” says Oliver Devlin. No Drama came together over several years and during its creation the band added multi-instrumentalist Callum Passels who provided all the horn arrangements on the LP. With Pearce producing his other The Beths bandmates Benjamin Sinclair added string arrangements while singer Elizabeth Stokes provided backing vocals. The result is Hans Pucket’s most sparkling and confident collection yet. While it’s danceable and fun it’s also a thoughtful exploration of anxiety a call for empathy in a turbulent time and a relatable reminder that it’s hard to figure things out. “People say ‘no drama’ all the time when they really mean at least ‘some drama ” laughs Callum Devlin of the album title. “It works because No Drama is actually a super dramatic record.” The LP is out October 28 2022 via Hans Pucket’s new label Carpark Records. + BuckToothSmelly

				Skating Polly + Bedsit

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									16/10/2025								
														Time:20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Buy Now
											
					
				

				Screaming Tarts presents… 
Skating Polly
+ Bedsit
Thursday October 16th 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets on sale NOW
Doors: 8.00pm
Over the past decade, few artists have embodied the unbridled freedom of punk like Skating Polly. Formed when stepsisters Kelli Mayo and Peyton Bighorse were just nine and 13, the Oklahoma-bred band have channeled their chameleonic musicality into a sound they call “ugly-pop,” unruly and subversive and wildly melodic.
With Kelli’s brother Kurtis Mayo joining on drums in 2017, they’ve also built a close-knit community of fans while earning the admiration of their musical forebears, a feat that’s found them collaborating with icons like X’s Exene Cervenka and Beat Happening’s Calvin Johnson, touring with Babes In Toyland, and starring as the subject of a feature-length documentary.
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

 Your Email (required)

89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events WaterBear All-Dayer Date: 18/10/2025 Time:13:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £1 Adv on sale now WaterBear Hull All-Dayer Saturday 18 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets will cost £1 with all proceeds donated to our tour partners Music Venue Trust. Tickets on sale now at the bottom of this page To warm up for our Keeping Music Live Tour we’re holding a huge all-day event at one of the UK’s most iconic grassroots venues – Hull’s legendary Adelphi Club on Saturday 18 October! Since 1984 this venue has been at the heart of Hull’s music scene and has hosted everyone from Radiohead and Oasis to PJ Harvey and Pulp. It’s more than a venue – it’s a cultural institution! ⚡ The night will feature a special guest headliner alongside performances from WaterBear artists and Hull’s best emerging talent! We’ve got multiple performance slots available to anyone at WaterBear Brighton Sheffield or online plus offer holders and alumni! We can’t wait to warm up for Keeping Music Live in one of the most legendary venues in the country. Hull – we’ll see you on October 18! MAFTIN POLITE BUREAUX ROTHCO MOTHERS DAY EMITTER KANUKAI WENCH GOOD DAMAGE With thanks to our Keeping Music Live Tour partners: @musicvenuetrust @saveoursceneuk @roughtrade @lovemusichateracism @fightbacklager

title: Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep + More – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep + More Date: 19/10/2025 Time:2025/10/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep Sunday 19 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £5 Tickets (At the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm Vegas on Bass was born in Bologna in 2022 with the plan to create energetic and positive music. Blurry Visions is their debut album released on February 28 2025. Vegas on Bass stand out for their energetic and aggressive sound inspired by the industrial rock of Nine Inch Nails with a sense of struggle and resilience. From the very beginning they stood out for their performances that charged up the audience performing in the clubs and the streets of the city mixing modern rock and melodies straight to the heart. In 2023 they set off on a tour culminating with two dates in London where they were welcomed with great enthusiasm. Riffs drive guitars execute technical moves and the music is big anthemic and epic but the groove is one straight out of the alternative nightclub. The Big Takeover (USA) ..a very electrifying work due to the energy it contains instigating the desire to go out and playing and captivating due to the harmony of the instruments and the enchanting vocals. Roadie Music (BRA) ..all I can say is that the amazing riffs the captivating melodies and the experimental influences blew me away immediately. Indie Tapes (GER) Vegas on Bass prove they’re more than just another band—they’re a movement. An unfiltered defiant burst of sound and emotion ready to shake up the scene and bring a new fearless energy to the world of rock. Odyssey (UK/USA)

title: Musicians Night – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Musicians Night Date: 20/10/2025 Time:2025/10/20 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU free Entry As Always Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe! Musicians Night Monday 20 October 2025 with your host Phill Wilson at The New Adelphi Club Free Entry As Always Doors from 8pm Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers. Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians. You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships. Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town! Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish. Please arrive early if you want to perform. *We now have SETMIXER! SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk. Every show is recorded mixed and available to the artists by the next morning. The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Emma Pollock (The Delgados) + Broken Chanter Date: 21/10/2025 Time:2025/10/21 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU Click Here Screaming Tarts presents Emma Pollock (The Delgados) + Broken Chanter Tuesday October 21 2025 The New Adelphi Club Doors:8.00pm Tickets on now Emma Pollock (The Delgados) Tickets | Tuesday 21 October 2025 at 20:45 A founding member of critically acclaimed Scottish band The Delgados Emma Pollock co-wrote and shared lead vocal duties on the 5 studio albums the band released between 1995 and 2005. 2000’s album ‘The Great Eastern’ was awarded a Mercury nomination. In 1995 Emma co-founded influential Glasgow record label Chemikal Underground and in 1997 co-founded recording studio Chem19 with the band both of which continue to run today. Following The Delgados’ split in 2005 Emma became a solo artist and has since released 3 solo albums; ‘Watch The Firewoks’ in 2007 ‘The Law Of Large Numbers’ (2010) and ‘In Search of Harperfield’ in 2016. Emma’s fourth solo album ‘Begging The Night To Take Hold’ is released on Chemikal Underground Records on 26 September 2025. 									Date:
									21/10/2025

				Screaming Tarts presents
Emma Pollock (The Delgados)
+ Broken Chanter
Tuesday October 21st 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Doors:8.00pm
Tickets on now
Emma Pollock (The Delgados) Tickets | Tuesday 21 October 2025 at 20:45
A founding member of critically acclaimed Scottish band The Delgados, Emma Pollock co-wrote and shared lead vocal duties on the 5 studio albums the band released between 1995 and 2005. 2000’s album ‘The Great Eastern’ was awarded a Mercury nomination.
In 1995 Emma co-founded influential Glasgow record label Chemikal Underground and in 1997 co-founded recording studio Chem19 with the band, both of which continue to run today.
Following The Delgados’ split in 2005, Emma became a solo artist and has since released 3 solo albums; ‘Watch The Firewoks’ in 2007, ‘The Law Of Large Numbers’ (2010) and ‘In Search of Harperfield’ in 2016.
Emma’s fourth solo album ‘Begging The Night To Take Hold’ is released on Chemikal Underground Records on 26th September 2025.

				Screaming Tarts presents
Emma Pollock (The Delgados)
+ Broken Chanter
Tuesday October 21st 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Doors:8.00pm
Tickets on now
Emma Pollock (The Delgados) Tickets | Tuesday 21 October 2025 at 20:45
A founding member of critically acclaimed Scottish band The Delgados, Emma Pollock co-wrote and shared lead vocal duties on the 5 studio albums the band released between 1995 and 2005. 2000’s album ‘The Great Eastern’ was awarded a Mercury nomination.
In 1995 Emma co-founded influential Glasgow record label Chemikal Underground and in 1997 co-founded recording studio Chem19 with the band, both of which continue to run today.
Following The Delgados’ split in 2005, Emma became a solo artist and has since released 3 solo albums; ‘Watch The Firewoks’ in 2007, ‘The Law Of Large Numbers’ (2010) and ‘In Search of Harperfield’ in 2016.
Emma’s fourth solo album ‘Begging The Night To Take Hold’ is released on Chemikal Underground Records on 26th September 2025.

Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Toby Hay + Holly Blackshaw Date: 22/10/2025 Time:2025/10/22 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Toby Hay + Holly Blackshaw Wednesday 22 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £8 on this page Doors: 8.00pmToby Hay Instrumental guitarist Toby Hay is emerging out of his Radnorshire home for a one off show at The New Adelphi Club. With him he brings Hull folkie Holly Blackshaw returning to play her home.Toby Hay has been likened to Robbie Basho John Fahey Bert Jansch and the like and with the release of his latest album ‘New Music for the Six String Guitar’ Toby brings the landscape of Mid Wales to East Yorkshire through his music. www.tobyhay.com + Holly Blackshaw Holly Blackshaw uprooted to Mid Wales from Hull in 2020. Formerly of Crooked Weather Holly performs rarely and now sings old and new songs trad and self penned with the aid of an old guitar and occasional Shruti box. A perfect mid week evening not be missed.

title: EVER + Supports – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events EVER + Supports Date: 23/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click for Tickets EVER + Supports Thursday 23 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets here Doors: 8.00pm EVER is an alternative rock band from North-East Lincolnshire UK. Influenced by the grunge of Nirvana and Pearl Jam – and pumped-up by the scuzzy pop-punk of Green Day – the band built a legion of fans with a series of self-released singles throughout 2024. With their songs grabbing the attention of people worldwide across social media and streaming platforms the band were spotted by Grammy award winning producer Rob Cavallo. A nod of approval from the man responsible for production duties on classic albums like Dookie and The Black Parade is no mean feat and EVER swiftly signed to Cavallo’s management company. Having already landed a spot on EA sports NHL soundtrack with their debut single the band picked up a booking agent and began to take their next steps. Rolling on to 2025 and with appearances at the likes of Live at Leeds and Neighbourhood Festival in Manchester already under their belt EVER have started to plot their adventures further afield. In February the east-coast trio travelled to Los Angeles to record their debut album with Cavallo; in the summer they will appear at festivals including 2000 Trees and Liverpool Sound City. There is much much more to come. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				EVER + Supports

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									23/10/2025

				EVER
+ Supports
Thursday 23rd October 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets here
Doors: 8.00pm
EVER is an alternative rock band from North-East Lincolnshire, UK. Influenced by the grunge of Nirvana and Pearl Jam – and pumped-up by the scuzzy pop-punk of Green Day – the band built a legion of fans with a series of self-released singles throughout 2024.
With their songs grabbing the attention of people worldwide across social media and streaming platforms, the band were spotted by Grammy award winning producer Rob Cavallo.
A nod of approval from the man responsible for production duties on classic albums like Dookie and The Black Parade is no mean feat, and EVER swiftly signed to Cavallo’s management company.
Having already landed a spot on EA sports NHL soundtrack with their debut single, the band picked up a booking agent and began to take their next steps.
Rolling on to 2025, and with appearances at the likes of Live at Leeds and Neighbourhood Festival in Manchester already under their belt, EVER have started to plot their adventures further afield.
In February, the east-coast trio travelled to Los Angeles to record their debut album with Cavallo; in the summer they will appear at festivals including 2000 Trees and Liverpool Sound City.
There is much, much more to come.
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU

dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Bull + Black Kes + Serial Chiller Date: 24/10/2025 Time:2025/10/24 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU £10 Advance Bull + Black Kes + Serial Chiller Friday 24 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 (at the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm Bull Returning for the 1 time in a couple of years we are delighted to welcome back the much loved Bull. Formed by vocalist and songwriter Tom Beer and guitarist Dan Lucas Bull’s mission is simply to make the music they wanted to listen to inspired by their 90’s heroes such Pavement Yo La Tengo and the Pixies. The rest of the band came together through a mix of friendships and happenstance. Drummer Tom Gabbatiss joined after he and Tom jammed together in bars while they were back-packing round Thailand and Kai West had previously used to jump up on stage with the band and “Bez” (verb meaning to dance badly while intoxicated) before they eventually let him play bass.
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

The Music Capital of Hull Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Bull + Black Kes + Serial Chiller Date: 24/10/2025 Time:2025/10/24 20:00 Location: Hull, East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St, Hull HU5 2RU £10 Advance Bull + Black Kes + Serial Chiller Friday 24th October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 (at the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm Bull Returning for the 1st time in a couple of years we are delighted to welcome back the much loved Bull. Formed by vocalist and songwriter Tom Beer and guitarist Dan Lucas, Bull’s mission is simply to make the music they wanted to listen to, inspired by their 90’s heroes such Pavement, Yo La Tengo and the Pixies. The rest of the band came together through a mix of friendships and happenstance. Drummer Tom Gabbatiss joined after he and Tom jammed together in bars while they were back-packing round Thailand, and Kai West had previously used to jump up on stage with the band and “Bez” (verb meaning to dance badly while intoxicated) before they eventually let him play bass.

title: Curtis Eller’s American Circus – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Curtis Eller’s American Circus Date: 25/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire. Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £12.50 Advance Curtis Eller’s American Circus + Rose Greenwood Saturday 25 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £12.50 Advance / £15 OTD Curtis Eller is a banjo player songwriter and rock & roll singer. The beloved show business veteran started his career at the age of seven as a juggler and acrobat but has since turned to the banjo because that’s where the money is. The iconoclastic troubadour has spent thirty years relentlessly touring the burlesque houses beer halls underground theatres and punk rock shitholes of North American Europe and Australia where his legendary shows once earned him the title “New York’s angriest yodeling banjo player”. His band The American Circus has developed a devoted international following based on spellbinding stage performances that combine an unsettling vision of American history with silent film style physical comedy and explosive rock & roll energy. The band has released a string of strange and compelling phonograph recordings that present a dreamlike vision of American history where all points in time have collapsed into one. Fans of past recordings have come to expect a hallucinatory historical landscape populated by corrupt 19 century politicians faded Hollywood stars two-bit prize fighters and frequent inexplicable visits from Elvis Presley and Richard Nixon. The ever-evolving cast of musicians spares no effort in their quest to bring Eller’s historically evocative compositions to vivid cinematic life. “A moustachioed New York yodelling banjo player Eller sings for the unsung rump-shakes for the ne’er remembered and leg trembles for histories forgotten. He is a theatre of movement: a twitching twirling time machine whose songs transport you back to the lost annals of history” “Curtis Eller is a born eccentric a throwback to a bygone age of Vaudevillian minstrel entertainment Buster Keaton-esque slapstick humour & circus clowning boxing rings & showgirls but all delivered with a contemporary street attitude; a song & dance man for our times”
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

The beloved show business veteran started his career at the age of seven as a juggler and acrobat, but has since turned to the banjo because that’s where the money is. The iconoclastic troubadour has spent thirty years relentlessly touring the burlesque houses, beer halls, underground theatres, and punk rock shitholes of North American, Europe, and Australia, where his legendary shows once earned him the title, “New York’s angriest yodeling banjo player”. His band, The American Circus, has developed a devoted international following based on spellbinding stage performances that combine an unsettling vision of American history with silent film style, physical comedy, and explosive rock & roll energy. The band has released a string of strange and compelling, phonograph recordings that present a dreamlike vision of American history where all points in time have collapsed into one. Fans of past recordings have come to expect a hallucinatory, historical landscape populated by corrupt 19th century politicians, faded Hollywood stars, two-bit prize fighters and frequent, inexplicable visits from Elvis Presley and Richard Nixon. The ever-evolving cast of musicians spares no effort in their quest to bring Eller’s historically evocative compositions to vivid, cinematic life. “A moustachioed, New York, yodelling banjo player, Eller sings for the unsung, rump-shakes for the ne’er remembered, and leg trembles for histories forgotten. He is a theatre of movement: a twitching, twirling time machine whose songs transport you back to the lost annals of history” “Curtis Eller is a born eccentric, a throwback to a bygone age of Vaudevillian minstrel entertainment, Buster Keaton-esque slapstick humour & circus clowning, boxing rings & showgirls but all delivered with a  contemporary street attitude; a song & dance man for our times”

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Musicians Night Date: 27/10/2025 Time:2025/10/27 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Free Entry as always Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe! Musicians Night Monday 27 October 2025 with your host Phill Wilson at The New Adelphi Club Free Entry As Always Doors from 8pm Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers. Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians. You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships. Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town! Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish. Please arrive early if you want to perform. *We now have SETMIXER! SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk. Every show is recorded mixed and available to the artists by the next morning. The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote. 				Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe!
Musicians Night
Monday 27th October 2025
with your host Phill Wilson at  The New Adelphi Club
Free Entry As Always
Doors from 8pm
Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers.
Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians.
You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships.
Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town!
Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish.
Please arrive early if you want to perform.
*We now have SETMIXER!
SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk.
Every show is recorded, mixed and available to the artists by the next morning.
The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote.

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Joe Solo & Jess Silk Date: 02/11/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Joe Solo & Jess Silk ( Double headliner) Sunday November 2 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 +bf Doors : 8.00pm Due to popular demand after their co-headline tour at the end of 2024 Joe Solo and Jess Silk are joining forces again this November (2025) to bring their particular brand of often political folk/punk music to venues across the country. Jess Silk is a guitarist singer and songwriter from the Black Country. Her shouty but melodic brand of folk/punk music gets people sitting up and listening. Armed only with an increasingly sticker-covered acoustic guitar lyrics right from the heart and a distinctive gravelly voice that many don’t expect Jess plays to audiences up and down the UK and has shared stages with many well known names among the folk/punk scene. Jess released her debut album Break the Bottle in May 2018 with a packed out show at her spiritual home of Katie Fitzgerald’s in Stourbridge. Since then she’s shared a number of other releases including two live EP’s with tracks taken from shows at Katie’s and HMV Merry Hill. 2020 saw the world shut down and Jess release two (almost completely) self produced EPs the first of which If We’re Damned was put together from songs that had been gathering metaphorical dust on her hard drive and the second There’s A Bar At the End Of the World a collection of songs written between March and August taking their inspiration from the events of the year. At the end of August 2021 Jess released her second full-length album Blitz Spirit and in April 2025 will be releasing her next EP which was recorded at Metway Studios in Brighton. In recent years Jess has appeared at a number of festivals including Bearded Theory Rebellion Beautiful Days and Glastonbury where she shared a stage with Billy Bragg as part of his Radical Roundup on the Left Field stage. In March 2023 Jess played six shows supporting the Levellers and she continues to tour around the UK playing festivals supports and her own headline tours. Joe Solo is an award-winning musician writer poet activist broadcaster and washing machine engineer from Scarborough. His musical odyssey began in 1987 fronting a bash-em-out band at school and has seen him play nine countries either as lynchpin of pop-punk upstarts Lithium Joe or hammering out his unique brand of Folk Punk and Blues in his own right. On top of releasing twenty one albums since 2004 Solo has written a series of children’s books for Unison on social justice and equality; ran a research project on the Hull Pals Battalions in the First World War; hosts a weekly radio show; had one of his poems used in an international campaign to educate on dementia awareness; co-runs ‘May Day Festival of Solidarity‘ an annual event bringing together voices from music poetry and politics to celebrate International Worker’s Day; and has opened for the likes of Paul Heaton & Jacqui Abbott Billy Bragg TV Smith Grace Petrie Pete Wylie and The Blockheads; whilst his songs have been played by John Peel on Radio One Mike Harding on Radio Two and Tom Robinson on BBC6Music. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				Joe Solo & Jess Silk ( Double headliner)
Sunday November 2nd 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets £10 +bf
Doors : 8.00pm
Due to popular demand after their co-headline tour at the end of 2024, Joe Solo and Jess Silk are joining forces again this November (2025) to bring their particular brand of often political folk/punk music to venues across the country.
Jess Silk is a guitarist, singer and songwriter from the Black Country. Her shouty but melodic brand of folk/punk music gets people sitting up and listening. Armed only with an increasingly sticker-covered acoustic guitar, lyrics right from the heart and a distinctive, gravelly voice that many don’t expect, Jess plays to audiences up and down the UK and has shared stages with many well known names among the folk/punk scene.
Jess released her debut album, Break the Bottle, in May 2018 with a packed out show at her spiritual home of Katie Fitzgerald’s in Stourbridge. Since then she’s shared a number of other releases including two live EP’s with tracks taken from shows at Katie’s and HMV Merry Hill. 2020 saw the world shut down and Jess release two (almost completely) self produced EPs, the first of which, If We’re Damned, was put together from songs that had been gathering metaphorical dust on her hard drive, and the second, There’s A Bar At the End Of the World, a collection of songs written between March and August taking their inspiration from the events of the year. At the end of August 2021 Jess released her second full-length album Blitz Spirit, and in April 2025 will be releasing her next EP which was recorded at Metway Studios in Brighton.
In recent years Jess has appeared at a number of festivals including Bearded Theory, Rebellion, Beautiful Days and Glastonbury where she shared a stage with Billy Bragg as part of his Radical Roundup on the Left Field stage. In March 2023 Jess played six shows supporting the Levellers and she continues to tour around the UK playing festivals, supports and her own headline tours.
Joe Solo is an award-winning musician, writer, poet, activist, broadcaster and washing machine engineer from Scarborough. His musical odyssey began in 1987 fronting a bash-em-out band at school, and has seen him play nine countries either as lynchpin of pop-punk upstarts Lithium Joe or hammering out his unique brand of Folk, Punk and Blues in his own right.
On top of releasing twenty one albums since 2004, Solo has written a series of children’s books for Unison on social justice and equality; ran a research project on the Hull Pals Battalions in the First World War; hosts a weekly radio show; had one of his poems used in an international campaign to educate on dementia awareness; co-runs ‘May Day Festival of Solidarity‘ an annual event bringing together voices from music, poetry and politics to celebrate International Worker’s Day; and has opened for the likes of Paul Heaton & Jacqui Abbott, Billy Bragg, TV Smith, Grace Petrie, Pete Wylie, and The Blockheads; whilst his songs have been played by John Peel on Radio One, Mike Harding on Radio Two and Tom Robinson on BBC6Music.

					Events
			




			
		
		

			
				
				
					
											
				

			

			

				Joe Solo & Jess Silk

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									02/11/2025								
														Time:20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Buy Now
											
					
				

				Joe Solo & Jess Silk ( Double headliner)
Sunday November 2nd 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets £10 +bf
Doors : 8.00pm
Due to popular demand after their co-headline tour at the end of 2024, Joe Solo and Jess Silk are joining forces again this November (2025) to bring their particular brand of often political folk/punk music to venues across the country.
Jess Silk is a guitarist, singer and songwriter from the Black Country. Her shouty but melodic brand of folk/punk music gets people sitting up and listening. Armed only with an increasingly sticker-covered acoustic guitar, lyrics right from the heart and a distinctive, gravelly voice that many don’t expect, Jess plays to audiences up and down the UK and has shared stages with many well known names among the folk/punk scene.
Jess released her debut album, Break the Bottle, in May 2018 with a packed out show at her spiritual home of Katie Fitzgerald’s in Stourbridge. Since then she’s shared a number of other releases including two live EP’s with tracks taken from shows at Katie’s and HMV Merry Hill. 2020 saw the world shut down and Jess release two (almost completely) self produced EPs, the first of which, If We’re Damned, was put together from songs that had been gathering metaphorical dust on her hard drive, and the second, There’s A Bar At the End Of the World, a collection of songs written between March and August taking their inspiration from the events of the year. At the end of August 2021 Jess released her second full-length album Blitz Spirit, and in April 2025 will be releasing her next EP which was recorded at Metway Studios in Brighton.
In recent years Jess has appeared at a number of festivals including Bearded Theory, Rebellion, Beautiful Days and Glastonbury where she shared a stage with Billy Bragg as part of his Radical Roundup on the Left Field stage. In March 2023 Jess played six shows supporting the Levellers and she continues to tour around the UK playing festivals, supports and her own headline tours.
Joe Solo is an award-winning musician, writer, poet, activist, broadcaster and washing machine engineer from Scarborough. His musical odyssey began in 1987 fronting a bash-em-out band at school, and has seen him play nine countries either as lynchpin of pop-punk upstarts Lithium Joe or hammering out his unique brand of Folk, Punk and Blues in his own right.
On top of releasing twenty one albums since 2004, Solo has written a series of children’s books for Unison on social justice and equality; ran a research project on the Hull Pals Battalions in the First World War; hosts a weekly radio show; had one of his poems used in an international campaign to educate on dementia awareness; co-runs ‘May Day Festival of Solidarity‘ an annual event bringing together voices from music, poetry and politics to celebrate International Worker’s Day; and has opened for the likes of Paul Heaton & Jacqui Abbott, Billy Bragg, TV Smith, Grace Petrie, Pete Wylie, and The Blockheads; whilst his songs have been played by John Peel on Radio One, Mike Harding on Radio Two and Tom Robinson on BBC6Music.

title: Charming Disaster + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Charming Disaster + Support Date: 05/11/2025 Time:2025/11/05 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy now Charming Disaster + Support Wednesday 5 November The New Adelphi Club £7 Advance Doors: 8.00pm Charming Disaster are a goth-folk musical duo based in New York City formed in 2012 by Ellia Bisker and Jeff Morris. Inspired by the macabre humor of Edward Gorey Tim Burton and Charles Addams the murder ballads of the Americana tradition and the dramatic flair of the cabaret they write playfully dark songs about death crime myth magic science and the occult. In their interactive shows songs are selected by chance by audience members who draw cards from the Charming Disaster Oracle Deck—a Tarot-style divination that straddles the line between concert and theatre. Charming Disaster’s music has been featured on the podcast Welcome to Night Vale they have toured the United States and Europe and have opened for Rasputina Voltaire and The Dresden Dolls. Recent appearances include the Rochester Fringe Festival Philadelphia’s Science History Institute Cleveland’s Wizbang Circus Theatre and NYC’s Coney Island Sideshow stage. Their latest album The Double was released in May 2025 to critical acclaim. “Dressed like ghostly prom dates who ran off with the tarot reader the Brooklyn-based pair turned the joint into a gothic cabaret where every strum stomp and stare felt enchanted. With a Gibson from the grave and a deck of cards from the occult they let fate pick the playlist — a high-stakes game of cabaret roulette…The whole thing? Mesmerizing madcap and maybe a little cursed — in the best possible way.” –Unrated Magazine “Live their onstage banter—equal parts sarcastic stage whisper and conspiratorial wink—transforms each set into a midnight salon where clever wordplay and playful repartee keep the crowd on delighted tenterhooks.“ –Grimrose Manor “Bisker and Morris excel at presenting a kind of cabaret of shadows while also providing a safe place to explore the spooky.” –CITY Rochester “One of the most spellbinding acoustic goth-folk-cabaret duos ever to walk the earth.” –Metal Shock Finland “It’s pretty hard to find folk that is as spellbinding as it is humorous but Charming Disaster executes such a feat while barely breaking as much as a cold sweat…It’s kind of like Coven meets the Carpenters or Captain & Tennille if they had barely escaped the collapse of the Process Church with their lives and immortal souls intact.” –I Thought I Heard a Sound “The song…builds and builds with the most delightful sense of dread imaginable. If you’re the type of person that finds the macabre fun and intriguing you’re going to adore “Cherry Red.” –If It’s Too Loud “There is just no bad spot to start with in Charming Disaster’s catalog…the natural world and metaphysical realm are explored with a murder ballad folk noir and tense cabaret hybrid that no one else could replicate.” –Tom Haugen Take Effect Reviews “Glorious…the kind of soundtrack you’d expect to find on a 1930s cartoon about a Prohibition-era Voodoo funeral…just be careful if they offer you a drink.” –Goldmine Magazine

title: Aimée Fatale – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Aimée Fatale Date: 07/11/2025 Time:2025/11/07 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU SOLD OUT This event SOLD OUT in 30 minutes! Aimée Fatale + support Friday 7 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Doors: 8.00pm 14+ with an adult (25+) Don’t miss Aimée Fatale’s first ever headline show this November 7 at The Adelphi. After releasing her much-anticipated debut single and already amassing almost 150k streams in 5 days Aimée Fatale returns to the Adelphi an integral venue in her musical journey for her debut headline show on November 7. dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Sam Scherdel Date: 08/11/2025 Time:2025/11/08 19:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Sam Scherdel + Diddie Hair + Amelia Quinn Saturday 8 November The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 + bf Doors: 7.00pm 14+ with an Adult ( over 25) Sam Scherdel has rapidly become one of the most talked-about new voices in British alternative music. Since the release of his debut EP in February 2025 his Springsteen-esque storytelling gravel-soaked vocals and electric live shows have marked him out as one of the most exciting emerging artists in the North of England. Having sold out headline shows and appeared at Glastonbury Tramlines and Humber Street Sesh Sam now heads back out on the road in 2025 ahead of the release of his highly-anticipated second body of work. Expect emotionally charged lyricism big heartland choruses and the raw energy that has earned him a rapidly growing reputation across the UK. We welcome Sam back to The Adelphi ahead of his first headline show at the club having previously played here in April 2024. Sam Scherdel has rapidly become one of the most talked-about new voices in British alternative music. Since the release of his debut EP in February 2025, his Springsteen-esque storytelling, gravel-soaked vocals and electric live shows have marked him out as one of the most exciting emerging artists in the North of England.
Having sold out headline shows and appeared at Glastonbury, Tramlines and Humber Street Sesh, Sam now heads back out on the road in 2025 ahead of the release of his highly-anticipated second body of work. Expect emotionally charged lyricism, big heartland choruses and the raw energy that has earned him a rapidly growing reputation across the UK.
We welcome Sam back to The Adelphi ahead of his first headline show at the club having previously played here in April 2024.

Doors: 8.00pm Rattle are a drum duo from Nottingham UK. They have released albums via Upset The Rhythm toured with Animal Collective The Julie Ruin Protomartyr and Thurston Moore Group and enjoy making mesmeric music that explores rhythm and tension through percussion and voice. Their 3 album Encircle came out on 28 February and features four songs balancing restless energy with restorative space.

title: Musicians Night – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Musicians Night Date: 10/11/2025 Time:2025/11/10 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Free Entry as always Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe! Musicians Night Monday 10 November 2025 with your host Phill Wilson at The New Adelphi Club Free Entry As Always Doors from 8pm Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers. Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians. You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships. Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town! Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish. Please arrive early if you want to perform. *We now have SETMIXER! SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk. Every show is recorded mixed and available to the artists by the next morning. The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Free Entry as always
											
					
				

				Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe!
Musicians Night
Monday 10th November 2025
with your host Phill Wilson at  The New Adelphi Club
Free Entry As Always
Doors from 8pm
Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers.
Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians.
You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships.
Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town!
Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish.
Please arrive early if you want to perform.
*We now have SETMIXER!
SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk.
Every show is recorded, mixed and available to the artists by the next morning.
The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote.

									Date:

				Under The Influence presents…
Pentire
+ Support
Saturday 15th November
The New Adelphi Club
£12.00 Adv Click Here
Doors: 8.00pm
Pentire are an indie band who make pop songs for the post-jangle generation through the smiles and sweat of the mosh pit. This Herefordshire four-piece tell cheap lager-soaked stories of student life, a small-town upbringing, and the innocence of youth.
Brought up on a diet of The Killers, Paolo Nutini and Stereophonics, frontman and principal songwriter Jack formed a band with his best mate Owen in the sleepy town of Ross-on-Wye. The two friends met drummer Jake and bass player Jacob whilst at university, which cemented the four-piece that is now selling out venues across the UK.
With previous support from tastemakers such as Jack Saunders (BBC Radio 1), Steve Lamacq (BBC 6Music), John Kennedy (RadioX) and Spotify’s Fresh Finds playlist, the band completed a landmark sold-out UK tour in early 2024.
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

title: Hawklords – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Hawklords Date: 16/11/2025 Time:2025/11/16 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents Hawklords. Sunday November 16 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £18.50 Doors: 8.00pm Described by the band as “a coda” to the TIME SPACE and RELATIVITY concept albums Hawklords 2025 album Faith examines aspects of the human metaphysical world and ties together ‘loose strands’ from the TSR trilogy. Designed to be much more of a cinematic audio release this album delivers a blend of soundscapes and thought-provoking songs which have all been crafted to give the listener a completely immersive space-rock experience. From the bludgeoning power of STRANGE LAND through to the sci-fi short story TETHERED this is HAWKLORDS ‘Musik Cinematique’ at its best. Featuring a powerhouse collective of musicians brought together under the Hawklords banner to create this enthralling spectrum of ‘Space-Rock & Roll’. Originally formed in 1978 from the ashes of The Sonic Assassins by Robert Calvert and Dave Brock of Hawkwind this British Space-Rock Band has toured the UK and Europe consistently since rebooting in 2008. https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3465049 Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Sunday November 16th 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Tickets £18.50
Doors: 8.00pm


Described by the band as “a coda” to the TIME, SPACE and RELATIVITY concept albums, Hawklords 2025 album, Faith, examines aspects of the human metaphysical world and ties together ‘loose strands’ from the TSR trilogy.

Designed to be much more of a cinematic audio release, this album delivers a blend of soundscapes and thought-provoking songs which have all been crafted to give the listener a completely immersive space-rock experience.
From the bludgeoning power of STRANGE LAND, through to the sci-fi short story, TETHERED, this is HAWKLORDS ‘Musik Cinematique’ at its best.

Featuring a powerhouse collective of musicians, brought together under the Hawklords banner to create this enthralling spectrum of ‘Space-Rock & Roll’.

Originally formed in 1978 from the ashes of The Sonic Assassins, by Robert Calvert and Dave Brock of Hawkwind, this British Space-Rock Band has toured the UK and Europe consistently since rebooting in 2008.
https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3465049

HU5 2RU

title: Steady Habits + SloWaltz – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Steady Habits + SloWaltz Date: 19/11/2025 Time:2025/11/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £8 Advance Steady Habits + SloWaltz Wednesday 19 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £8 Advance/£10 OTD Doors 8.00pm A flair for alt-country sounds melodic pop-hooks and a voice that can blast it to the back of the room Steady Habits is centred around the lyrical narrative of New-England native Sean C. Duggan. Holding a place in “the youthful side of Americana” [Country Queer] Duggan’s songwriting is poignant with a sensitivity and grit that is reminiscent of artists like Jason Isbell Dawes & BJ Barnham [American Aquarium]. Pinned as one of the UK’s ‘Best of UK Country & Americana’ [Holler] Steady Habits has performed across the UK & Internationally supporting artists such as The Hanging Stars Our Man in the Field Morganway & Demi Marriner and have performed at a number of of high-profile festivals such as The AMA UK Conference Black Deer Truck Festival & the Long Road Festival . Sean was featured as a finalist for Holler’s song writing competition for ‘Deviate’ a joyful and semi-autobiographical song about his upbringing as a young queer kid in the US. “Best of British Country & Americana “​ Holler 2024 “An excellent band with tremendous potential…an exciting blend of 90’s nostalgia” Americana UK “…some mighty clever songwriting that lands on the youthful side of americana merging pop hooks with alt-country twang” ​Country Queer ​ “With a blend of country and folk influences Steady Habits’ genuine camaraderie and seamless vocal harmonies create a captivating experience for their listeners.” ​-DC Brown ​ “Steady Habits show that they have something really special to offer.”​ -Yorkshire Times + SloWaltz Exciting project by acclaimed songwriters Martin Clappison and Tom Kay. Known locally for their time together in The Mighty and The Moon their extensive solo work and projects such as The Broken Orchestra Martin and Tom have joined forces once again and returned with an intimate atmospheric indie folk sound drawing inspiration from the likes of Nick Cave Kathryn Joseph and Radiohead. Expect haunting melodies raw emotion and a soundscape that lingers long after the last note fades.​

Guest email cannot be repeated.

Duggan. Holding a place in “the youthful side of Americana” [Country Queer], Duggan’s songwriting is poignant, with a sensitivity and grit that is reminiscent of artists like Jason Isbell, Dawes & BJ Barnham [American Aquarium]. Pinned as one of the UK’s ‘Best of UK Country & Americana’ [Holler], Steady Habits has performed across the UK & Internationally, supporting artists such as The Hanging Stars, Our Man in the Field, Morganway & Demi Marriner and have performed at a number of of high-profile festivals such as The AMA UK Conference, Black Deer, Truck Festival & the Long Road Festival . Sean was featured as a finalist for Holler’s song writing competition for ‘Deviate’, a joyful and semi-autobiographical song about his upbringing as a young queer kid in the US. “Best of British Country & Americana “​ Holler, 2024 “An excellent band with tremendous potential…an exciting blend of 90’s nostalgia” Americana UK “…some mighty clever songwriting that lands on the youthful side of americana, merging pop hooks with alt-country twang” ​Country Queer ​ “With a blend of country and folk influences, Steady Habits’ genuine camaraderie and seamless vocal harmonies create a captivating experience for their listeners.” ​-DC Brown ​ “Steady Habits show that they have something really special to offer.”​ -Yorkshire Times + SloWaltz Exciting project by acclaimed songwriters Martin Clappison and Tom Kay. Known locally for their time together in The Mighty and The Moon, their extensive solo work, and projects such as The Broken Orchestra, Martin and Tom have joined forces once again and returned with an intimate, atmospheric indie folk sound, drawing inspiration from the likes of Nick Cave, Kathryn Joseph, and Radiohead. Expect haunting melodies, raw emotion, and a soundscape that lingers long after the last note fades.​
