Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Steady Habits + SloWaltz Date: 19/11/2025 Time:2025/11/19 20:00 Location: Hull, East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU  £8 Advance Steady Habits + SloWaltz Wednesday 19th November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £8 Advance/£10 OTD Doors 8.00pm A flair for alt-country sounds, melodic pop-hooks, and a voice that can blast it to the back of the room, Steady Habits is centred around the lyrical narrative of New-England native, Sean C. Duggan. Holding a place in “the youthful side of Americana” [Country Queer], Duggan’s songwriting is poignant, with a sensitivity and grit that is reminiscent of artists like Jason Isbell, Dawes & BJ Barnham [American Aquarium]. Pinned as one of the UK’s ‘Best of UK Country & Americana’ [Holler], Steady Habits has performed across the UK & Internationally, supporting artists such as The Hanging Stars, Our Man in the Field, Morganway & Demi Marriner and have performed at a number of of high-profile festivals such as The AMA UK Conference, Black Deer, Truck Festival & the Long Road Festival . Sean was featured as a finalist for Holler’s song writing competition for ‘Deviate’, a joyful and semi-autobiographical song about his upbringing as a young queer kid in the US. “Best of British Country & Americana “​ Holler, 2024 “An excellent band with tremendous potential…an exciting blend of 90’s nostalgia” Americana UK “…some mighty clever songwriting that lands on the youthful side of americana, merging pop hooks with alt-country twang” ​Country Queer ​ “With a blend of country and folk influences, Steady Habits’ genuine camaraderie and seamless vocal harmonies create a captivating experience for their listeners.” ​-DC Brown ​ “Steady Habits show that they have something really special to offer.”​ -Yorkshire Times + SloWaltz Exciting project by acclaimed songwriters Martin Clappison and Tom Kay. Known locally for their time together in The Mighty and The Moon, their extensive solo work, and projects such as The Broken Orchestra, Martin and Tom have joined forces once again and returned with an intimate, atmospheric indie folk sound, drawing inspiration from the likes of Nick Cave, Kathryn Joseph, and Radiohead. Expect haunting melodies, raw emotion, and a soundscape that lingers long after the last note fades.​

FUNLAND is produced recorded and mixed by Ben Hampson (DITZ Lambrini Girls) and mastered by Katie Tavini (Bloc Party We Are Scientists). It will be released on various formats on 10 October 2025 via Cowboy À La Mode (TWDYE own label) in partnership with À Tant Rêver Du Roi (France) Luik Records (Belgium) and Conicle Records (Cassette Release). They’ll be joined by Sheffield noise merchants Knorke and Hull faves Neoplastic.

dateText: 26 November 2025

title: Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Date: 26/11/2025 Time:2025/11/26 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU £8 Advance Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Wednesday 26 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £8 Adv/£10 OTD Doors 8pm Avalanche Kaito Belgium Trio Avalanche Kaito bring their fusion of post-punk no wave and afro-groove to The Adelphi as part of a rare UK tour. The band are made up of guitarist Nico Gitto drummer Benjamin Chaval and singer the Burkina Faso griot Kaito Winse. “Mixing up the West African folk traditions of urban griot Kaito Winse with the avant-punk of Belgian guitarist Nico Gitto and French drummer/producer Benjamin Chaval Talitakum is the second album of joyful noise from transnational trio Avalanche Kaito. It is both more cohesive and wide-ranging than their debut hardened on the road but still crammed with rough-edged vigour. Their sound is a striking molten blend that sparks and shakes with life. Driven by an unstoppable uplifting energy this is a record in touch with music’s ritual power … This is a twenty-first century sound that contains and connects with the past. Afropunk futurism. The eternal ecstatic impulse.’ ”The Quietus “… [Kaito Winse’s] stream of consciousness method of singing (where he converses with his ancestors) could be compared to that of original Can vocalist Malcolm Mooney in that he is a single free spirit performing within an otherwise tightly disciplined group of musicians: drummer Benjamin Chaval and guitarist Nico Gitto erect rhythmic electronically pulsed structures – with enough elasticity for Winse to bounce his extraordinary vocal around through a selection of spoken recitations bird calls and lyrical flute exhalations…..” The Wire
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

The Music Capital of Hull Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Date: 26/11/2025 Time:2025/11/26 20:00 Location: Hull, East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St, Hull HU5 2RU £8 Advance Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Wednesday 26th November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £8 Adv/£10 OTD Doors 8pm Avalanche Kaito Belgium Trio Avalanche Kaito bring their fusion of post-punk, no wave and afro-groove to The Adelphi as part of a rare UK tour. The band are made up of guitarist Nico Gitto , drummer Benjamin Chaval and singer, the Burkina Faso griot, Kaito Winse. “Mixing up the West African folk traditions of urban griot Kaito Winse with the avant-punk of Belgian guitarist Nico Gitto and French drummer/producer Benjamin Chaval, Talitakum is the second album of joyful noise from transnational trio Avalanche Kaito. It is both more cohesive and wide-ranging than their debut, hardened on the road but still crammed with rough-edged vigour. Their sound is a striking, molten blend that sparks and shakes with life. Driven by an unstoppable uplifting energy, this is a record in touch with music’s ritual power … This is a twenty-first century sound that contains and connects with the past. Afropunk futurism. The eternal ecstatic impulse.’ ”The Quietus “… [Kaito Winse’s] stream of consciousness method of singing (where he converses with his ancestors) could be compared to that of original Can vocalist Malcolm Mooney, in that he is a single free spirit performing within an otherwise tightly disciplined group of musicians: drummer Benjamin Chaval and guitarist Nico Gitto erect rhythmic, electronically pulsed structures – with enough elasticity for Winse to bounce his extraordinary vocal around, through a selection of spoken recitations, bird calls and lyrical flute exhalations…..” The Wire
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

title: Infidels + Life Aquatic Band – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Infidels + Life Aquatic Band Date: 27/11/2025 Time:2025/11/27 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Life Aquatic Band + Infidels DOUBLE WHAMMY HEADLINER SHOW! Thursday 27 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club £7 Advance Doors: 8.00pm Infidels The wonderful return of Infidels to their spiritual home. Always a brilliant live act… alt-indie-rock featuring some of the city’s best musicians and friends of the club. Infidels had a flurry of ace singles and national radio play… ‘How About You’ being featured on BBC Radio6 Music… the band have also seen remixes done by OTO and Jordan Smith of BDRMM. Life Aquatic Band Sheffield’s finest fusion band return to Adelphi bringing their blend of funk groove punk soul and dance to the Adelphi dancefloor. “The psychedelic curveball you need in your life” – NME “Deliciously upbeat and life affirming” Tom Robinson – BBC 6 Music “A blend of new and old post punk” Steve Lamaqc BBC 6 Music
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Black Kes + Gary Paradiso Date: 29/11/2025 Time:2025/11/29 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £5 on the door Black Kes + Gary Paradiso Saturday 29 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club £5.00 OTD Doors:8.00pm You are invited to a wonderful evening of merriment hop on board the Black Kes fun bus for a night to fulfill your very soul. Let’s all party as if our very lives depend upon it. Let us chase as if the spirit of Benny Hill has possessed our fundamental being. Let us all sing the songs and dance dance dance.joining Black Kes on this special occasion is the remarkable Gary Paradiso fresh from his sell out tour of Center Parcs and keen to go shopping in the Harrods of the North (Boyes). The knowers know.Black Kes can’t wait to party with you guys it’s the best.xxx Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				Black Kes + Gary Paradiso

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									29/11/2025								
														Time:2025/11/29 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 £5 on the door
											
					
				

				Black Kes
+ Gary Paradiso
Saturday 29th November 2025
The New Adelphi Club
£5.00 OTD
Doors:8.00pm
You are invited to a wonderful evening of merriment, hop on board the Black Kes fun bus for a night to fulfill your very soul. Let’s all party as if our very lives depend upon it.
Let us chase as if the spirit of Benny Hill has possessed our fundamental being. Let us all sing the songs and dance, dance dance.joining Black Kes on this special occasion is the remarkable Gary Paradiso, fresh from his sell out tour of Center Parcs, and keen to go shopping in the Harrods of the North (Boyes).
The knowers know.Black Kes can’t wait to party with you guys, it’s the best.xxx
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Kingmaker + Support Date: 06/12/2025 Time:2025/12/06 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click to Buy Kingmaker + Support Saturday 6 December 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £12 Advance from seetickets Doors: 8.00pm They were Hull’s very own indie rockers. With a string of top 40 singles during the early 90s Kingmaker burst on to the scene as contemporaries of the Pixies and the The Wonder Stuff before splitting just as Brit-pop gripped the nation. title: Sunday Lunch (Walk-ins Only · Bring Cash · Come Hungry)
999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events 999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost Date: 24/09/2022 Time:2022/09/24 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU52RU Venue: 999 + The Crooked 45 + Ketamine Kow – The New Adelphi Club Click to Buy The Breakfast Club presents Punk Legends 999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost + DJ Liquidizer Saturday 24 September 2022 £15 Advance from https://www.seetickets.com/event/the-breakfast-club-presents-999/the-new-adelphi-club/2289987 999 will celebrate their 46 anniversary on 5 December 2022. The reason for their longevity is not airplay massive publicity hype or even a major recording deal but word of mouth and that “word of mouth” now extends to nearly every country on earth. 999 were first conceived in late 1976 when Nick Cash (vocals/guitar) and Guy Days (vocals/lead guitar) who were at school together decided to form a group. Within a couple of months they had teamed up with Jon Watson (bass) and Pablo Labritain (drums) and 999 were officially born. Their first gig was at the Northampton Cricket Club in January 1977. Interest in the band was immediate and constant gigging around London brought with it critical acclaim and a hard core following of supporters from Southall calling themselves “The Crew”. These ranks were soon swollen by the Manchester Birmingham Edinburgh Munich Vienna Zagreb Stockholm Oslo Berlin New York LA. Toronto Philadelphia and San Francisco “Crews” each proving as dedicated as the last. The frenzy and raw energy of the early days were captured by their debut single “I’m Alive on the bands own Labritain label and sold well enough to become a minor hit. Next through their association with United Artists records the second and third singles “Nasty Nasty” and the now classic “Emergency” were released both scaling the lower reaches of the charts and confirming 999 to be one of the major forces in the British New Wave Movement. The first album titled simply “999” was released and was greeted with impressive sales and critical acclaim. Extensive touring took them throughout Britain and Europe where they now encountered full houses. The second album “Separates” was released and immediately the single “Homicide” leapt straight into the UK top forty without any Radio airplay and was banned by the BBC and most radio stations. Early 1979 saw the band embarking on their first U.S. tour which was an achievement in itself as they were still without a record deal in America at the time. Response to the band was ecstatic all the venues being filled and import albums being sold out in a rush of enthusiasm. The band were immediately booked for a return trip. Since leaving United Artists 999 have recorded another eleven albums. Jon Watson was replaced in 1986 on bass by Danny Palmer and subsequently by Arturo Bassick in 1991. To date the band have completed 15 U.S. tours 101 London gigs 36 UK tours and 24 European tours visiting Finland Sweden Norway Germany Belgium Holland France Spain Portugal Italy and Yugoslavia Japan Argentina and Brazil. We are delighted to welcome 999 back The Adelphi for the first time in four and a half years. This will be a great night. 999 will celebrate their 46th anniversary on 5th December 2022. The reason for their longevity is not airplay, massive publicity, hype or even a major recording deal but word of mouth and that “word of mouth” now extends to nearly every country on earth.
999 were first conceived in late 1976 when Nick Cash (vocals/guitar) and Guy Days (vocals/lead guitar), who were at school together, decided to form a group. Within a couple of months they had teamed up with Jon Watson (bass) and Pablo Labritain (drums) and 999 were officially born. Their first gig was at the Northampton Cricket Club in January 1977. Interest in the band was immediate and constant gigging around London brought with it critical acclaim and a hard core following of supporters from Southall, calling themselves “The Crew”. These ranks were soon swollen by the Manchester, Birmingham, Edinburgh, Munich, Vienna, Zagreb, Stockholm, Oslo, Berlin, New York, LA., Toronto, Philadelphia, and San Francisco “Crews” each proving as dedicated as the last.
The frenzy and raw energy of the early days were captured by their debut single “I’m Alive on the bands own Labritain label and sold well enough to become a minor hit. Next through their association with United Artists records the second and third singles, “Nasty Nasty” and the now classic “Emergency” were released both scaling the lower reaches of the charts and confirming 999 to be one of the major forces in the British New Wave Movement.
The first album titled simply “999” was released and was greeted with impressive sales and critical acclaim. Extensive touring took them throughout Britain and Europe where they now encountered full houses.
The second album “Separates” was released and immediately the single “Homicide” leapt straight into the UK top forty without any Radio airplay and was banned by the BBC and most radio stations.
Early 1979 saw the band embarking on their first U.S. tour, which was an achievement in itself, as they were still without a record deal in America at the time. Response to the band was ecstatic, all the venues being filled and import albums being sold out in a rush of enthusiasm. The band were immediately booked for a return trip.
Since leaving United Artists 999 have recorded another eleven albums. Jon Watson was replaced in 1986 on bass by Danny Palmer and subsequently by Arturo Bassick in 1991. To date the band have completed 15 U.S. tours, 101 London gigs, 36 UK tours and 24 European tours visiting Finland, Sweden, Norway, Germany, Belgium, Holland, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy and Yugoslavia, Japan, Argentina and Brazil.
We are delighted to welcome 999 back The Adelphi for the first time in four and a half years. This will be a great night.

Interest in the band was immediate and constant gigging around London brought with it critical acclaim and a hard core following of supporters from Southall, calling themselves “The Crew”. These ranks were soon swollen by the Manchester, Birmingham, Edinburgh, Munich, Vienna, Zagreb, Stockholm, Oslo, Berlin, New York, LA., Toronto, Philadelphia, and San Francisco “Crews” each proving as dedicated as the last.
The frenzy and raw energy of the early days were captured by their debut single “I’m Alive on the bands own Labritain label and sold well enough to become a minor hit. Next through their association with United Artists records the second and third singles, “Nasty Nasty” and the now classic “Emergency” were released both scaling the lower reaches of the charts and confirming 999 to be one of the major forces in the British New Wave Movement.
The first album titled simply “999” was released and was greeted with impressive sales and critical acclaim. Extensive touring took them throughout Britain and Europe where they now encountered full houses.
The second album “Separates” was released and immediately the single “Homicide” leapt straight into the UK top forty without any Radio airplay and was banned by the BBC and most radio stations.
Early 1979 saw the band embarking on their first U.S. tour, which was an achievement in itself, as they were still without a record deal in America at the time. Response to the band was ecstatic, all the venues being filled and import albums being sold out in a rush of enthusiasm. The band were immediately booked for a return trip.
Since leaving United Artists 999 have recorded another eleven albums. Jon Watson was replaced in 1986 on bass by Danny Palmer and subsequently by Arturo Bassick in 1991. To date the band have completed 15 U.S. tours, 101 London gigs, 36 UK tours and 24 European tours visiting Finland, Sweden, Norway, Germany, Belgium, Holland, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy and Yugoslavia, Japan, Argentina and Brazil.
We are delighted to welcome 999 back The Adelphi for the first time in four and a half years. This will be a great night.
 
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

title: The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand – 40th Anniversary Month – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 23/10/2024 Time:2024/10/23 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £7.50 Advance Part of The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand Wednesday 23 October 2024 The New Adelphi Club £7.50 Tickets on this page /£9.00 OTD Doors 8pm The Froot Homegrown Hull heroes bringing you their refreshing 60’s & 70’s pysch- rock influenced sounds to the Adelphi’s 40 anniversary month. Always a brilliant live experience these boys have been working hard building up a national following and have recently been in the studio as they prepare to release new material very soon. Wynona Bleach One of the most exciting prospects coming out of Northern Ireland currently signed to Fierce Panda who released their debut album ‘Moonsoake’ which sold out immediately and is now on its second vinyl pressing. They’ve played Reading and were hand picked by Jerry Cantrell to support Alice in Chains on their Irish dates. Last year they played New Colossus festival in New York alongside 10 massively successful shows at South by South West support October Drift on the Belfast date of their tour and were tour support for Ash on their Irish dates. Picking up national radio support from Steve Lamacq on BBC6Music Huw Stephens and Annie Mac. They have a new single out in June this year ahead of the album with full PR campaigns and label support for both.

Guest email cannot be repeated.

title: Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash – Warm Exit + No Peeling – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash – Warm Exit + No Peeling Date: 11/12/2025 Time:2025/12/11 19:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Pay what you like Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash featuring… Warm Exit (Brussels) + No Feeling (Nottingham) Thursday 11 December 2025 The New Adelphi Club Pay what you like! Doors: 7.00pm (Early Finish) We’ll all be wrapped up in bed by 11.00pm Warm Exit is a post-punk quartet based in Brussels Belgium formed in 2020. Their music blends a raw intense energy with influences ranging from post-punk and industrial avant-garde to kraut and noise. With a sound that echoes the spirit of bands like Birthday Party LCD Soundsystem and PIL Warm Exit’s debut album Ultra Violence explores the darker corners of post-punk. The record moves between contrasting tempos and dynamic energy levels with vocals that range from haunting whispers to powerful raw screams. The band’s soundscape features moments of dissonance evocative spoken word and industrial textures creating a compelling atmosphere for listeners. 				Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash – Warm Exit + No Peeling

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									11/12/2025								
														Time:2025/12/11 19:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Pay what you like
											
					
				

				Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash featuring…
Warm Exit (Brussels)
+ No Feeling (Nottingham)
Thursday 11th December 2025
The New Adelphi Club
Pay what you like!
Doors: 7.00pm (Early Finish)
We’ll all be wrapped up in bed by 11.00pm
Warm Exit is a post-punk quartet based in Brussels, Belgium, formed in 2020. Their music blends a raw, intense energy with influences ranging from post-punk and industrial avant-garde to kraut and noise.
With a sound that echoes the spirit of bands like Birthday Party, LCD Soundsystem, and PIL, Warm Exit’s debut album Ultra Violence explores the darker corners of post-punk. The record moves between contrasting tempos and dynamic energy levels, with vocals that range from haunting whispers to powerful, raw screams.
The band’s soundscape features moments of dissonance, evocative spoken word, and industrial textures, creating a compelling atmosphere for listeners.
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

 Your Email (required)

89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

				The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2024

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									07/01/2024								
														Time:2024/01/07 19:00												Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU													
								Venue:
								The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2023
																	–
									The New Adelphi Club
															
																										 Free Entry / £3 to play
											
					
				

				The 21st Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2024
For the coveted Jimmy Trophy
Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney
See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event.
3 boards on stage, 64 players enter, there’s only one winner!
Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa”, crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts!
Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome.
Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm.
Maximum 64 participants, so don’t be late!
Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night.
£3 entry to play, spectators go free.
Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm.
It’s just for fun !
Rules 2024
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

title: Nam Jam 2024 – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Nam Jam 2024 Date: 15/09/2024 Time:2024/09/15 12:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Nam Jam 2024 – The New Adelphi Club Buy Now Nam Jam 2024 Sunday 15 September 2024 All-Day Event 12.00-22.00pm Nam Jam is back! Join us for an unforgettable day of entertainment and support for Palestine!– **Flash Tattoos**: Get inked by talented artists offering unique designs.– **Live Bands**: Enjoy music from amazing local bands that will keep you dancing all night.– **Burlesque Show**: Be dazzled by a stunning burlesque performer.– **Special Performances**: Additional acts and surprises throughout the evening.–**Pizza** from Hulls own ‘of slice and men’ with an exclusive menu for the event.**Why Attend?**Every ticket sold a donation made goes directly to supporting vital humanitarian efforts in Palestine. Your participation will help provide essential aid and bring hope to those in need.Come together for a night of fun and philanthropy. Let’s make a difference **Follow us on @namaste_tattoo for updates and more details.** Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Join us for an unforgettable day of entertainment and support for Palestine!– **Flash Tattoos**: Get inked by talented artists offering unique designs.– **Live Bands**: Enjoy music from amazing local bands that will keep you dancing all night.– **Burlesque Show**: Be dazzled by a stunning burlesque performer.– **Special Performances**: Additional acts and surprises throughout the evening.–**Pizza** from Hulls own ‘of slice and men’ with an exclusive menu for the event.**Why Attend?**Every ticket sold a donation made goes directly to supporting vital humanitarian efforts in Palestine. Your participation will help provide essential aid and bring hope to those in need.Come together for a night of fun and philanthropy. Let’s make a difference **Follow us on @namaste_tattoo for updates and more details.**
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events bdrmm + special guests (Christmas Special) Date: 20/12/2025 Time:2025/12/20 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click Here What the fuck are bdrmm putting on this Christmas then? bdrmm + special guests Saturday 20 December 2025 (Day One) The New Adelphi Club £22.50 Adv +bf from seetickets BANG! It’s the sound of the question that nobody ever asks! Our annual Christmas Extravaganza is levelling up. Since every year is a bit of a squeeze we’ve decided to extend the party to two nights instead of one. Catch us soaking the walls of the Adelphi on Saturday 20 and Sunday 21 December 2025. Expect cheap pints fun merch and raucous beats. We’re also incredibly excited to bring a stellar cast of supporting artists to Sunny Hull for these shows which will be announced in due course. This Christmas Extravaganza promises to be the most unforgettable yet. Don’t miss out. £22.5 (+bf) Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! + special guests
Saturday 20th December 2025 (Day One)
The New Adelphi Club
£22.50 Adv +bf from seetickets
BANG! It’s the sound of the question that nobody ever asks! Our annual Christmas Extravaganza is levelling up. Since every year is a bit of a squeeze, we’ve decided to extend the party to two nights instead of one. Catch us soaking the walls of the Adelphi on Saturday 20th, and Sunday 21st December 2025. Expect cheap pints, fun merch, and raucous beats.
We’re also incredibly excited to bring a stellar cast of supporting artists to Sunny Hull for these shows which will be announced in due course.
This Christmas Extravaganza promises to be the most unforgettable yet. Don’t miss out.
£22.5 (+bf)

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Outcharms – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 24/10/2024 Time:2024/10/24 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Part Of The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations – The New Adelphi Club £10 Adv Click Here As Part Of The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations The Outcharms + Support Thursday 24 October Tickets £10 + bf from skiddle Doors: 8.00pm MA Promotions Presents are pleased to announce The Outcharms will be returning to Hull for the 40 anniversary at The New Adelphi Club on Thursday 24 October.Forged in the shadow of Sheffield’s bustling music scene The Outcharms fly their own flag as Doncaster’s finest with their signature style of sparkling guitars and massive choruses that have shook venues up and down the country. Since forming in 2014 The ‘Charms have surpassed milestones which seemed unthinkable as four schoolkids in a then-town eclipsed by the towering heights of the rest of South Yorkshire’s musical pedigree.Already supporting the likes of Louis Tomlinson Reverend And The Makers and The Fratellis the boys are honing their craft for turning heads and pricking up ears. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				The Outcharms – 40th Anniversary Month

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									24/10/2024								
														Time:2024/10/24 20:00												Location: 89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU													
								Venue:
								Part Of The Adelphi 40th Anniversary Celebrations
																	–
									The New Adelphi Club
															
																										 £10 Adv Click Here
											
					
				

				As Part Of The Adelphi 40th Anniversary Celebrations
The Outcharms
+ Support
Thursday 24th October
Tickets £10 + bf from skiddle
Doors: 8.00pm
MA Promotions Presents are pleased to announce The Outcharms will be returning to Hull for the 40th anniversary at The New Adelphi Club on Thursday 24th October.Forged in the shadow of Sheffield’s bustling music scene, The Outcharms fly their own flag as Doncaster’s finest with their signature style of sparkling guitars and massive choruses that have shook venues up and down the country. Since forming in 2014, The ‘Charms have surpassed milestones which seemed unthinkable as four schoolkids in a then-town eclipsed by the towering heights of the rest of South Yorkshire’s musical pedigree.Already supporting the likes of Louis Tomlinson, Reverend And The Makers and The Fratellis, the boys are honing their craft for turning heads and pricking up ears.
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Lowest Pair + Support Date: 23/01/2026 Time:2026/01/23 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents The Lowest Pair Friday 23 January 2026 The New Adelphi Club £14 Adv from seetickets click here Doors 8pm Kendl Winter and Palmer T. Lee are two kindred spirits who first met on the banks of the Mississippi while touring the Midwest festival circuit. Born and raised in Arkansas Winter found herself drawn to evergreens of the Pacific Northwest as well as the boundless music scene of Olympia Washington. She released solo records on Olympia-based indie label K Records and performed in ramblin’ folk bands and anarchic punk bands before serendipitously meeting Palmer T. Lee in 2013. Lee had built his first banjo when he was 19 from pieces he inherited and began cutting his teeth fronting Minneapolis string bands before convincing Winter that they should form a banjo duo. Now as The Lowest Pair they have spent a decade performing thousands of shows across North America and the UK and have a new record planned for 2026.Tickets on sale now >>>https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3502519 Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				Screaming Tarts presents
The Lowest Pair
Friday 23rd January 2026
The New Adelphi Club
£14 Adv from seetickets click here
Doors 8pm
Kendl Winter and Palmer T. Lee are two kindred spirits who first met on the banks of the Mississippi while touring the Midwest festival circuit.
Born and raised in Arkansas, Winter found herself drawn to evergreens of the Pacific Northwest, as well as the boundless music scene of Olympia, Washington.
She released solo records on Olympia-based indie label, K Records, and performed in ramblin’ folk bands and anarchic punk bands before serendipitously meeting Palmer T. Lee in 2013.
Lee had built his first banjo when he was 19 from pieces he inherited and began cutting his teeth fronting Minneapolis string bands before convincing Winter that they should form a banjo duo. Now, as The Lowest Pair, they have spent a decade performing thousands of shows across North America and the UK and have a new record planned for 2026.Tickets on sale now >>>https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3502519

									Date:
									23/01/2026								
														Time:2026/01/23 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire

				Screaming Tarts presents
The Lowest Pair
Friday 23rd January 2026
The New Adelphi Club
£14 Adv from seetickets click here
Doors 8pm
Kendl Winter and Palmer T. Lee are two kindred spirits who first met on the banks of the Mississippi while touring the Midwest festival circuit.
Born and raised in Arkansas, Winter found herself drawn to evergreens of the Pacific Northwest, as well as the boundless music scene of Olympia, Washington.
She released solo records on Olympia-based indie label, K Records, and performed in ramblin’ folk bands and anarchic punk bands before serendipitously meeting Palmer T. Lee in 2013.
Lee had built his first banjo when he was 19 from pieces he inherited and began cutting his teeth fronting Minneapolis string bands before convincing Winter that they should form a banjo duo. Now, as The Lowest Pair, they have spent a decade performing thousands of shows across North America and the UK and have a new record planned for 2026.Tickets on sale now >>>https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3502519

title: Open Mic hosted by Louie Donoghue
Dominie Hooper + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Dominie Hooper + Support Date: 28/01/2026 Time:2026/01/28 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Advance Dominie Hooper + Support Wednesday 28 January 2026 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 Adv (on this page) Doors: 8.00pm Dominie Hooper is a London-based singer songwriter and multi-instrumentalist crafting spellbinding music rooted in folklore ritual and emotional transformation. Her songs simmer with raw intensity and lyrical barbs blending growling cello textured guitar and collective vocals into something dark unsettling and beautiful. Her debut single for Lost Map Records Land produced by Ben Hillier (Depeche Mode Nadine Shah) is a powerful meditation on healing and self-reclamation. Written while reflecting on her upbringing in the wilds of Dartmoor the track conjures a landscape of isolation memory and grounded magic. “It’s about choosing the path of healing again and again ” Dominie explains. “Magic folklore and myth offer archetypes through which we can flip our own script.” Dominie’s sound draws comparisons to the brooding drama of PJ Harvey and John Parish the raw emotional weight of Magnolia Electric Co. and the timeless power of Richard & Linda Thompson. Her commanding voice and blistering live band have already earned her support slots with This Is The Kit multiple UK headline tours and appearances at festivals including Shambala Deer Shed and Moseley Folk. With early support from BBC 6Music BBC Introducing Radio 2 and RTÉ 2 plus backing from Help Musicians and PRSF Dominie is poised for a breakout year. Her upcoming debut album In This Body Lives due for release on Hallowe’en 2025 promises to deepen the spell. As Under the Radar Magazine put it “The breadth of her talent is immediately apparent.” “Endlessly engaging and thrilling” – Guy Garvey BBC 6Music “Absolutely beautiful” – Shaun Keaveny “Spine-tingling” – Roddy Hart BBC Radio Scotland “Amazing amazing track” – BBC Introducing

Her upcoming debut album, In This Body Lives, due for release on Hallowe’en 2025, promises to deepen the spell. As Under the Radar Magazine put it, “The breadth of her talent is immediately apparent.” “Endlessly engaging and thrilling” – Guy Garvey, BBC 6Music “Absolutely beautiful” – Shaun Keaveny “Spine-tingling” – Roddy Hart, BBC Radio Scotland “Amazing, amazing track” – BBC Introducing

Doors: 8.00pm Los Fastidios…..from Verona (Italy) since 1991 always on the road of the world more than one hundred shows every year playing from Streetpunk to the 2Tone ska sound crossing rock’n’roll brit-pop and early reggae in the name of fun with thoughtful and social lyrics which fills the dancefloor from the first until the last second of concert…the original Enrico lead vocal is since few years joined by the sweet and lovely voice of Elisa Dixan that gave the band a new better and even more engaging mood.

title: Plantoid + Brunnhilde + Algeron Cargo Cult – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Plantoid + Brunnhilde + Algeron Cargo Cult Date: 21/02/2026 Time:2026/02/21 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Adv Plantoid + Brunnhilde + Algeron Cargo Cult Saturday 21 February 2025 The New Adelphi Club £10 Advance Tickets (at the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm A sonic exploration intertwining psych jazz and prog rock. Plantoid began as a project of life partners Chloe Coyne and Tom Coyne who met as students at Lincoln College in the UK. The duo had a passion for quirky fusion style music and created the band Mangó to mix the disparate styles of psychedelia with jazz indie rock math rock post-punk and other ethnic sounds. After gigging around Brighton they picked up bassist Bernardo Larisch and drummer Louis Bradshaw and changed their name to Plantoid. Having successfully honed their chops the band caught the attention of the Bella Union and released several singles. In 2024 Plantoid released its first eclectic prog released titled Terrapath and displays a distinct creative style of fusion that stand out from the various prog scenes.
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

The Music Capital of Hull Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Plantoid + Brunnhilde + Algeron Cargo Cult Date: 21/02/2026 Time:2026/02/21 20:00 Location: Hull, East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU £10 Adv Plantoid + Brunnhilde + Algeron Cargo Cult Saturday 21st February 2025 The New Adelphi Club £10 Advance Tickets (at the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm A sonic exploration intertwining psych jazz and prog rock. Plantoid began as a project of life partners Chloe Coyne and Tom Coyne who met as students at Lincoln College in the UK. The duo had a passion for quirky fusion style music and created the band Mangó to mix the disparate styles of psychedelia with jazz, indie rock, math rock, post-punk and other ethnic sounds. After gigging around Brighton they picked up bassist Bernardo Larisch and drummer Louis Bradshaw and changed their name to Plantoid. Having successfully honed their chops the band caught the attention of the Bella Union and released several singles. In 2024 Plantoid released its first eclectic prog released titled Terrapath and displays a distinct creative style of fusion that stand out from the various prog scenes.

title: Open Mic hosted by Louie Donoghue

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Keeley + Support Date: 26/02/2026 Time:2026/02/26 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents… KEELEY + support Thursday February 26 2026 The New Adelphi Club *** TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY AT 10AM *** KEELEY Tickets | Thursday 26 February 2026 at 20:45 Doors: 8.00pmKEELEY fronted by singer guitarist songwriter and charismatic Dubliner Keeley Moss enjoyed a transformative year in 2024. On 18 October they released their second album “Beautiful Mysterious” on Tiny Global Productions.An album brimming with songs that showcase the breadth of KEELEY’s songwriting bristling with lush harmonies muscular beats and inventive atmospherics weaving gleefully between indie-rock sub-genres and further establishing Keeley Moss as one of Ireland’s most creative songwriters.From the glorious haze of “Doorway To Another World” to the pulsating motorik beat of “Trans-Europe 18” aided by mixes from veteran producer Paul Tipler (Stereolab Placebo The House Of Love) Keeley and producer Alan Maguire make sure each song is a confection a box of musical chocolates stamped with a unique Irish swirl. The live band went from strength to strength in 2024 playing blistering support sets to Echobelly Terrorvision Miki Berenyi Trio and The Smyths and also enjoyed their first-ever festival date with a triumphant appearance at the Shiiine On Weekender. They are currently a trio featuring Keeley Moss on guitar and vocals Lukey Foxtrot on bass and former Morrissey drummer Andrew Paresi. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Doors: 8.00pmKEELEY, fronted by singer, guitarist, songwriter and charismatic Dubliner Keeley Moss enjoyed a transformative year in 2024. On 18th October, they released their second album “Beautiful Mysterious” on Tiny Global Productions.An album brimming with songs that showcase the breadth of KEELEY’s songwriting, bristling with lush harmonies, muscular beats and inventive atmospherics, weaving gleefully between indie-rock sub-genres and further establishing Keeley Moss as one of Ireland’s most creative songwriters.From the glorious haze of “Doorway To Another World” to the pulsating motorik beat of “Trans-Europe 18”, aided by mixes from veteran producer Paul Tipler (Stereolab, Placebo, The House Of Love), Keeley and producer Alan Maguire make sure each song is a confection, a box of musical chocolates stamped with a unique Irish swirl.
The live band went from strength to strength in 2024 playing blistering support sets to Echobelly, Terrorvision, Miki Berenyi Trio and The Smyths, and also enjoyed their first-ever festival date with a triumphant appearance at the Shiiine On Weekender.
They are currently a trio featuring Keeley Moss on guitar and vocals, Lukey Foxtrot on bass and former Morrissey drummer Andrew Paresi.

On 18th October, they released their second album “Beautiful Mysterious” on Tiny Global Productions.An album brimming with songs that showcase the breadth of KEELEY’s songwriting, bristling with lush harmonies, muscular beats and inventive atmospherics, weaving gleefully between indie-rock sub-genres and further establishing Keeley Moss as one of Ireland’s most creative songwriters.From the glorious haze of “Doorway To Another World” to the pulsating motorik beat of “Trans-Europe 18”, aided by mixes from veteran producer Paul Tipler (Stereolab, Placebo, The House Of Love), Keeley and producer Alan Maguire make sure each song is a confection, a box of musical chocolates stamped with a unique Irish swirl. The live band went from strength to strength in 2024 playing blistering support sets to Echobelly, Terrorvision, Miki Berenyi Trio and The Smyths, and also enjoyed their first-ever festival date with a triumphant appearance at the Shiiine On Weekender. They are currently a trio featuring Keeley Moss on guitar and vocals, Lukey Foxtrot on bass and former Morrissey drummer Andrew Paresi. Screaming Tarts presents…
KEELEY
+ support
Thursday February 26th 2026
The New Adelphi Club
*** TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY AT 10AM ***
KEELEY Tickets | Thursday 26 February 2026 at 20:45

Doors: 8.00pmKEELEY, fronted by singer, guitarist, songwriter and charismatic Dubliner Keeley Moss enjoyed a transformative year in 2024. On 18th October, they released their second album “Beautiful Mysterious” on Tiny Global Productions.An album brimming with songs that showcase the breadth of KEELEY’s songwriting, bristling with lush harmonies, muscular beats and inventive atmospherics, weaving gleefully between indie-rock sub-genres and further establishing Keeley Moss as one of Ireland’s most creative songwriters.From the glorious haze of “Doorway To Another World” to the pulsating motorik beat of “Trans-Europe 18”, aided by mixes from veteran producer Paul Tipler (Stereolab, Placebo, The House Of Love), Keeley and producer Alan Maguire make sure each song is a confection, a box of musical chocolates stamped with a unique Irish swirl.
The live band went from strength to strength in 2024 playing blistering support sets to Echobelly, Terrorvision, Miki Berenyi Trio and The Smyths, and also enjoyed their first-ever festival date with a triumphant appearance at the Shiiine On Weekender.
They are currently a trio featuring Keeley Moss on guitar and vocals, Lukey Foxtrot on bass and former Morrissey drummer Andrew Paresi.

Cam Cole – Come Together Tour UK 2026 The more tickets you buy the cheaper they get. With a new album a new show and a mission to make gigs an affordable group experience again Cam is touring the UK in March 2026. Why “Come Together” Tour? Because the more of your mates and loved ones you bring the cheaper the tickets get for all of you. Cam and support “The Dead Reds” will bring you raw and real psychedelic blues. And for an evening we can tell that bullshit that is going on outside to do one. See you there. Age Restriction: 14+. Under 18’s must be accompanied by an Adult. 				Kingmaker – 40th Anniversary Month

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									26/10/2024								
														Time:2024/10/26 20:00												Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU													
								Venue:
								Adelphi 40th Anniversary Month
																	–
									The New Adelphi Club
															
																										 SOLD OUT
											
					
				

				SOLD OUT
Kingmaker
+ Support
Saturday 26th October 2024
Part of the Adelphi 40th Anniversary celebrations
So you know 10 Years Asleep, Really Scrape the Sky, Lucy’s Down and Eat Yourself Whole right?
Maybe Armchair Anarchist and Two Headed Yellow Bellied Hole Digger?
But how about Celebrated Working Man? And what about those B-sides?
Over five years in the early 90s Hull’s finest indie rockers produced almost 30 tracks that never made it on to albums; the likes of Everything’s Changed Since You’ve Been To London, Kissing Under Anaesthetic, I’m In Love and Another Bad Dose of Home Truths.
For the first time ever the band will play a set including all their A- sides and a selection of their favourite back up tracks.
A-Sides, B-Sides, In-sides.
 
Also appearing at:
Manchester
Saturday 7th September 2024
Retro, Sackville Street – Tix from fatsoma
Birmingham
Saturday 28th September 2024
Hare & Hounds, Kings Heath – Tix from skiddle
				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)  






									
								
							
								Contact us			The New Adelphi Club
89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

title: Mr. Irish Bastard – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Mr. Irish Bastard Date: 19/03/2026 Time:2026/03/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click Here Screaming Tarts presents Mr. Irish Bastard + Support Thursday March 19 2026 The New Adelphi Club Adv Tickets £16 from seetickets Doors: 8.00pm Mr. Irish Bastard is one of the most formidable and recognised bands amongst the celtic punk genre around the world today. Staying true to the name the band was formed by purebred Irish Bastard Chris Lennon in Münster Germany after a night on the lash with fellow drunkard and deviant Jan Strecker. Armed with an acoustic guitar and a banjo the duo quickly recruited a motley crew of likeminded Irish (and German) hooligans and set off to conquer the world one Irish pub at a time. Four months roughly three hundred pork pies ninety packs of cigarettes fifty seven litres of Jameson and 3 concussions later the band emerged from the studio with their first attempt “St. Mary’s School of Drinking”. Seven songs about everything from drinking to… erm… drinking. … And the rest is history. History they will never remember unfortunately because well… alcohol. Which makes it kinda hard to write a band biography but according to Google Mr. Irish Bastard has shared the stage with bands of high ilk such as The Pogues Dropkick Murphys The Levellers and Flogging Molly (to name a few) and performed at some of the most prestigious festivals in Europe such as Wacken Rock Harz and Open Flair. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Staying true to the name, the band was formed by purebred Irish Bastard, Chris Lennon in Münster, Germany after a night on the lash with fellow drunkard and deviant, Jan Strecker. Armed with an acoustic guitar and a banjo, the duo quickly recruited a motley crew of likeminded Irish (and German) hooligans and set off to conquer the world, one Irish pub at a time. Four months, roughly three hundred pork pies, ninety packs of cigarettes, fifty seven litres of Jameson, and 3 concussions later, the band emerged from the studio with their first attempt “St. Mary’s School of Drinking”. Seven songs about everything from drinking, to… erm… drinking. … And the rest, is history. History they will never remember, unfortunately, because, well… alcohol. Which makes it kinda hard to write a band biography, but according to Google, Mr. Irish Bastard has shared the stage with bands of high ilk, such as The Pogues, Dropkick Murphys, The Levellers and Flogging Molly (to name a few), and performed at some of the most prestigious festivals in Europe such as Wacken, Rock Harz and Open Flair. 					Events
			




			
		
		

			
				
				
					
											
				

			

			

				Mr. Irish Bastard

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									19/03/2026								
														Time:2026/03/19 20:00												Location: Hull, East Yorkshire													
								Venue:
								The New Adelphi Club
																	–
									89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU
															
																										 Click Here
											
					
				

				
Screaming Tarts presents
Mr. Irish Bastard
+ Support
Thursday March 19th 2026
The New Adelphi Club
Adv Tickets £16 from seetickets 
Doors: 8.00pm
Mr. Irish Bastard is one of the most formidable and recognised bands amongst the celtic punk genre around the world today. Staying true to the name, the band was formed by purebred Irish Bastard, Chris Lennon in Münster, Germany after a night on the lash with fellow drunkard and deviant, Jan Strecker.
Armed with an acoustic guitar and a banjo, the duo quickly recruited a motley crew of likeminded Irish (and German) hooligans and set off to conquer the world, one Irish pub at a time.
Four months, roughly three hundred pork pies, ninety packs of cigarettes, fifty seven litres of Jameson, and 3 concussions later, the band emerged from the studio with their first attempt “St. Mary’s School of Drinking”. Seven songs about everything from drinking, to… erm… drinking.
… And the rest, is history.
History they will never remember, unfortunately, because, well… alcohol. Which makes it kinda hard to write a band biography, but according to Google, Mr. Irish Bastard has shared the stage with bands of high ilk, such as The Pogues, Dropkick Murphys, The Levellers and Flogging Molly (to name a few), and performed at some of the most prestigious festivals in Europe such as Wacken, Rock Harz and Open Flair.

				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!

 Your Email (required)

89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Everly Pregnant Brothers Date: 22/05/2026 Time:2026/05/22 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Back by popular demand… It’s the feel-good singalong night out you’ve been craving. Everly Pregnant Brothers + Support Friday 22 May 2026 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £22.50 Advance on this page. Doors 8pm. “A national treasure in their native Sheffield the Brothers playful tampering of classic songs has won them friends and fans far and wide”. The EVERLY Pregnant Brothers are the North’s premier parody ukulele band. Delighting audiences and ruining peoples favourite songs in equal measure. With a loyal following in their native South Yorkshire they have played festivals and venues across the country. They are played the main stage at last year’s sold out Tramlines Festival! “As partisan lyrics go “they tried to make me go to Derby – I said no no no!” is quite the match-winner. Lifted from their take on Amy Winehouse’s classic anti-therapy anthem Rehab in which Barnsley Rotherham Donnie and Leeds are also given short shrift the veteran Sheffield septet more than do it justice. Backed by drummer Nick Banks (of Pulp fame) and acclaimed illustrator Pete McKee (on ukulele) amongst others you’d have to have a heart of stone not to enjoy their joyous pater and quirky take on a hoard of classics. Bowie The Cure ABBA Coldplay Kings of Leon and Bob Marley are just a selection of the artists given mirthful re-workings the pick of which – Chip Pan (refrain – “yeah my chip’s on fire!”) – turns an already well-oiled crowd into a communal karaoke room. While Stuck In The Lidl With You (Stealers Wheel re-imagined) is almost as enjoyable. By the time Coldplay’s Yellow is sent up with an ode to the Steel City’s precious Hendo’s Relish hands are in the air and all cares of the world are slung to the wind. What’s quite brilliant though is how because you are concentrating on taking in the new lyrics you are also reminded of how brilliant the music is in the first place – clever that. By the time No Oven No Pie to the tune of Jamaica’s unofficial national anthem is aired everyone on and off stage is having an absolute ball. Long may The Everly Pregnant Brothers maternity leave last…” leftlion.co.uk
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

title: The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 Date: 04/01/2025 Time:2025/01/04 19:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 – The New Adelphi Club Book your seats soon The 22 Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 Saturday 4 January For the coveted Jimmy Trophy Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event. 3 boards on stage 64 players enter there’s only one winner! Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa” crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts! Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome. Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm. Maximum 64 participants so don’t be late! Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night. £3 entry to play spectators go free. Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm. It’s just for fun ! 2024 Champion – ‘Keen Kong’ (pictured below) could not wander the streets of Newland all year because of autograph hunters. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! 				The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025

								
				
					
					
																					
									Date:
									04/01/2025								
														Time:2025/01/04 19:00												Location: 89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU													
								Venue:
								The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025
																	–
									The New Adelphi Club
															
																										 Book your seats soon
											
					
				

				The 22nd Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025
Saturday 4th January
For the coveted Jimmy Trophy
Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney
See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event.
3 boards on stage, 64 players enter, there’s only one winner!
Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa”, crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts!
Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome.
Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm.
Maximum 64 participants, so don’t be late!
Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night.
£3 entry to play, spectators go free.
Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm.
It’s just for fun !
2024 Champion – ‘Keen Kong’
(pictured below) could not wander the streets of Newland all year because of autograph hunters.


				
			
			
		

	



	

	
		
			
				
					
						
							
															
									
							
								Mailing List			If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week, just fill in the short form below!


 



 Your Name (required)  
 Your Email (required)

89 De Grey Street, Beverley Road
Hull, East Yorkshire
Kingston Upon Hull
HU5 2RU
Call +44 (0) 1482 348216

									The New Adelphi Club
															
																										 Book your seats soon
											
					
				

				The 22nd Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025
Saturday 4th January
For the coveted Jimmy Trophy
Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney
See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event.
3 boards on stage, 64 players enter, there’s only one winner!
Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa”, crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts!
Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome.
Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm.
Maximum 64 participants, so don’t be late!
Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night.
£3 entry to play, spectators go free.
Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm.
It’s just for fun !
2024 Champion – ‘Keen Kong’
(pictured below) could not wander the streets of Newland all year because of autograph hunters.

title: The None + The 113 + Rothco. – 40th Anniversary Month – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The None + The 113 + Rothco. – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 19/10/2024 Time:2024/10/19 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £12 Advance The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month The None The 113 Rothco Saturday 19 October 2024 The New Adelphi Club £12.00 Advance Tickets Doors 8.00pm THE NONE is a new band of lifelong musicians. Comprising bassist Gordon Moakes (Bloc Party Young Legionnaire) vocalist Kaila Whyte (Blue Ruth Youth Man) guitarist Jim Beck (Cassels) and drummer Chris Francombe (Frauds) they make an uncompromising vision of noise rock with melody at its heart. The band formed at the start of 2023 and bonded over hours in the rehearsal room – making noise discussing shared obsessions and most importantly playing together. The anonymity of their name reflects a creative approach which favours egoless experimentation and open collaboration. This ethos the combined decades of music making and the unique musical identities of all four members can be clearly heard in the art they create. The band are gearing up for debut shows and releases in 2024. Fans of Shellac The Jesus Lizard Silverfish and Unwound will likely find plenty to enjoy. The 113 is a conjuration of a dark and visceral post-punk. The genre-bending project combines heavy guitars and racing rhythms with cathartic and emphatic melodies. Pounding through flesh and bone their music is overwhelming and their songs are absolute bangers but not exclusively suited for the dancefloor. The 113 is as much for the mosh pit kids in the front as for the timid music freaks in the back. Rothco. came storming out of the blocks for their debut show in April and blew the roof of The Adelphi. Post punk/agit punk/fuzz punk…featuring musicians from Hull royalty Rothco. are destined to leave a massive scar on the East Yorkshire coast. Brilliant!
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

Comprising bassist Gordon Moakes (Bloc Party, Young Legionnaire), vocalist Kaila Whyte (Blue Ruth, Youth Man), guitarist Jim Beck (Cassels) and drummer Chris Francombe (Frauds), they make an uncompromising vision of noise rock with melody at its heart. The band formed at the start of 2023 and bonded over hours in the rehearsal room – making noise, discussing shared obsessions, and, most importantly, playing together.  The anonymity of their name reflects a creative approach which favours egoless experimentation and open collaboration. This ethos, the combined decades of music making, and the unique musical identities of all four members can be clearly heard in the art they create. The band are gearing up for debut shows and releases in 2024. Fans of Shellac, The Jesus Lizard, Silverfish and Unwound will likely find plenty to enjoy. The 113 is a conjuration of a dark and visceral post-punk. The genre-bending project combines heavy guitars and racing rhythms, with cathartic and emphatic melodies. Pounding through flesh and bone, their music is overwhelming and their songs are absolute bangers, but not exclusively suited for the dancefloor. The 113 is as much for the mosh pit kids in the front, as for the timid music freaks in the back. Rothco. came storming out of the blocks for their debut show in April and blew the roof of The Adelphi. Post punk/agit punk/fuzz punk…featuring musicians from Hull royalty Rothco. are destined to leave a massive scar on the East Yorkshire coast. Brilliant!

title: Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Date: 09/04/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Adv Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Wednesday 9 April 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £10 Adv / £12 OTD Doors: 8.00pm So pleased to bring this to one of Attila’s favourite venues…. Attila the Stockbroker’s early music punk band Barnstormer 1649 are celebrating 30 years together with five Northern dates in April and Attila has invited his long-time fellow travellers and musical soulmates Blyth Power and punky young rail enthusiasts Indignation Meeting along for the ride. And to make a packed evening even more so he’ll be performing some of his latest and most topical poems in the changeovers. Soaring melodies words which echo down through history a substantial number of songs about trainspotting and apparently at least one poem about circumcision at 67; but don’t let that put you off! Please come.
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.

The Music Capital of Hull Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Date: 09/04/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull, East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street, Hull, HU5 2RU £10 Adv Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Wednesday 9th April 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £10 Adv / £12 OTD Doors: 8.00pm So pleased to bring this to one of Attila’s favourite venues…. Attila the Stockbroker’s early music punk band Barnstormer 1649 are celebrating 30 years together with five Northern dates in April, and Attila has invited his long-time fellow travellers and musical soulmates Blyth Power and punky young rail enthusiasts Indignation Meeting along for the ride. And to make a packed evening even more so he’ll be performing some of his latest and most topical poems in the changeovers. Soaring melodies, words which echo down through history, a substantial number of songs about trainspotting and, apparently, at least one poem about circumcision at 67; but don’t let that put you off! Please come.
Guest name cannot be repeated.
Guest email cannot be repeated.
